title: Letter, Reuben Gatward to Polly : life on the goldfields.
note: From collection: Diaries / Journals / Letters

title: Letter, Reuben Gatward to Polly : life on the goldfields.
note: Please note: Some of the metadata for this document has been taken from the Museum Victoria catalogue.

title: Letter, Reuben Gatward to Polly : life on the goldfields.
note: The letter is written on a wrapper for 'The Polygot Newsletter, a Summary in English, French, German and Spanish, for Transmission to Europe'. The Polygot was printed and published for the proprietors at the 'Punch' Office, Melbourne, October 1858. The wrapper has an etching of 'View on the Yarra near Dight's Mills' by F. Grusse on the front. The newsletter is an early example of a publication produced in several different languages; an indication of the 'multi-cultural' nature of the population of Victoria in the 1850s.

title: Letter, Reuben Gatward to Polly : life on the goldfields.

title: Shipboard diary, Walter Dutton, England to Australia, 1858.
note: Please note: Some of the metadata for this document has been taken from the Museum Victoria catalogue.

title: Shipboard diary, Walter Dutton, England to Australia, 1858.
note: The Sarah Dixon was built at the Dixon shipyard on the Tantramar River in Sackville, New Brunswick, Canada, and launched on 18 September 1856. It made only two voyages to Australia. The first left Liverpool on 13 June 1857 under W. Salt as Master and arrived at Port Phillip Bay on 12 September 1857, returning to Britain via Guam. The second voyage, on which Walter Dutton travelled, departed Liverpool on 29 August 1858, again under W. Salt, and arrived at Port Melbourne on 6 December 1858. It was carrying 9 first-class and 190 intermediate & steerage class passengers and a cargo of machinery. The Sarah Dixon departed Melbourne on 17 January 1859 bound for Bassein under ballast. In March 1859, the ship struck Baroguy Shoal in the Gulf of Marinban, near Rangoon, Burma and was a total loss.

title: Shipboard diary, Walter Dutton, England to Australia, 1858.

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, Zakarīyā al-Anṣārī al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jabara qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ bi-amdād jadhrihi al-matīn, wa-fataḥa la-hum bāb istikhrāj al-majhūl min al-maʻlūm al-razīn, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah, Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluh sayyid al-mursalīn, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-inna al-Muqniʻ al-manẓūm ʻalá baḥr al-ṭawīl fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah, lil-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wa-al-ḥabr al-mudaqqiq, Abī al-ʻAbbās Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-shahīr bi-Ibn al-Hāʼim al-Shāfiʻī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāh wa-jaʻala al-jannah maʼwāh, lammā kāna min abdaʻ kitāb fī al-jabr nuẓim, wa-ajmaʻ mawḍūʻ fīhi ʻalá miqdār ḥajmihi ruqim, ṭalaba minnī baʻḍ al-aʻizzah ʻalayy min al-fuḍalāʼ al-mutaraddidīn ilayy an aḍaʻa ʻalayhi sharḥan yaḥullu alfāẓah, wa-yubayyinu murādah, wa-yuqayyidu muṭlaqah, wa-yaftaḥu mughlaqah, fa-ajabtuhu ilá dhālik bi-ʻawn al-Qādir al-Mālik, ʻalá wajh laṭīf wa-manhaj munīf, wa-sammaytuhu bi-Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ ..."

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Secundo folio: qawluhu ʻalá al-Nabī al-Muṣṭafá.

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: 16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Binding: Unbound (in two quires).

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-Muqniʻ fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: On folio 1a: "al-Muqniʻ fī al-jabr."

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: The text of "al-Muqniʻ fī ʻilm al-jabr wa-al-muqābalah" starts with: "Bi-ḥamdi Ilāhī abtadī mā uḥāwilu // wa-uhdī ṣalātan maʻ salāmin yushākiluh. ʻAlá al-Muṣṭafá khayr al-anāmi wa-ālihi // wa-aṣḥābihi thumma al-duʻā yatawāṣalu. Li-fakhri al-zamān al-muntamī li-Jilāwatin // ʻAlīyin ʻalayhi suḥbu jūdin hawāṭilu ..." And it ends with: "... Wa-abyātuhā tisʻun wa-khamsūna unshiʼat // bi-al-Aqṣá wa-shahri al-yumni fa-hiya tuṭāwilu. Rabīʻun min al-ʻāmi alladhī ḍabṭu ʻaddihi // bi-Dālin wa-Ḍādin fa-al-thanā mutakāmilu." "al-Sharḥ: Ay bi-ʻām arbaʻah wa-thamānimiʼah, idh al-Dāl fī al-ḥisā̕b al-madhkūr [ḥisāb al-jummal], bi-arbaʻah, wa-al-Ḍād bi-thamānimiʼah ..."

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Colophon: "Tamma al-sharḥ al-mubārak ʻalá yad al-faqīr Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī, li-muntaṣaf Dhī al-Qaʻdah min shuhūr sanat alf wa-miʼah wa-sittah wa-sabʻīn, sanat 1176. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamm."

title: 880-03 Fatʹḥ al-Mubdiʻ fī sharḥ al-Muqniʻ : manuscript / Abū Yaḥyá Zakarīyā ibn Muḥammad al-Anṣārī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "The blessed commentary was completed by the hand of the poor Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī al-Shāfiʻī in the middle of Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1176 [of the Hijrah = 28 May, 1763]. May God pray on our Master and Lord Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Title from folio 1a.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Aḥmadu Allāh ʻalá an qaṣara salāmat al-ṭabʻ ʻalá nawʻ al-insān, wa-aḍmara fī ṭayy ṣudūrihim ḍurūb al-awdhān [al-awzān], wa-ḥallāhum bi-natāʼij fikr tuzrī ʻalá al-laʼālī al-manthūrah fī aḥshāʼ al-buḥūr, bul tuzrī bi-al-farāʼid al-manẓūmah fī qalāʼid nuḥūr al-ḥūr, ḥamdan dāʼiman ghayr maqṭūʻ, wa-ashkuruhu shukran musbaghan bi-al-uṣūl wa-muzayyalan [wa-mudhayyalan] bi-al-furūʻ, mā wuqifa fī ghāyāt al-āyāt ʻalá al-fawāṣil wa-al-aʻjāz, wa-kushifa bi-kaff al-bayān qināʻ al-rayb ʻan wujūh al-iʻjāz ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Secundo folio: ʻinda kaffihi al-maʻarrāt ʻan al-kaff.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: 15.5 x 20.3 cm; written surface: 9x 16 cm; 19 lines per page.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Binding: In marbled cardboard.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of "al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī" preceded by the the word "Qāla" (He said) and the commentary by the word "Qultu" (I said), in red; markings in red; many commentaries on the margins; text within red frame surrounded by a larger frame; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: On folios 1b-2a: "... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi kalimāt ... fī tashrīḥ mushkilāt al-Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ al-mansūb ilá al-Imām al-kāmil bi-Abī [Abī] ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad, al-maʻrūf bi-Abī al-Jaysh al-Anṣārī al-Andalusī ... daʻatnī ilá taʼlīfihā ishārāt ṣadarat min Janāb al-Amīr al-muʻaẓẓam wa-al-Ṣadr al-mufakhkham ... Sulaymān Bīk ibn al-Amīr al-aʻẓam wa-al-Wazīr al-akram ... Amīr Ṭāshiḥūn Bīk ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Colophon: "... Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnāh min 'Bayān mushkilāt al-Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ al-mawsūm bi-Andalusī', ḥāmidan wa-shākran lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ilhām al-taḥqīq wa-inʻām al-tawfīq. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-shukr la-hu ʻalá al-tamām, wa-lil-Rasūl afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Qad tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻizzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "... This is the end of what we intended to clarify of the problems of the compendium on the science of prosody, titled 'al-Andalusī'. I praise and thank God Most High for inspiring me and helping me to finish it. Praises and thanks to God for the completion. May the best prayer and peace be upon the Messenger [Prophet Muḥammad]. The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King. Praise be to the Lord, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they falsely attribute to Him. May peace be upon the messengers, and praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Title from folio 1b.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn, wa-Huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻāmil al-ʻallāmah, al-ʻumdah al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah, jāmiʻ ashtāt al-faḍāʼil, baqīyat al-salaf al-amāthil, Abū ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī al-Shāfiʻī al-Makkī, aʻāda Allāh ʻalaynā min barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi al-bāhiyah al-bāhirah, wa-afāḍa ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min fayḍ madad buḥūr funūnihi al-zākiyah al-fākhirah, wa-taghammadahu bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu baḥbūḥat Jannatih. Āmīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ikhtaṣṣa Nabīyanā Muḥammadan, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-Kitābihi alladhī akhrasa al-fuṣaḥāʼ wa-aʻjaza al-bulaghāʼ ʻan al-tafawwuh bi-mithl aqṣar sūrah min suwarih, bal āyah min āyātih, wa-bi-jawāmiʻ al-kalim, wa-badāʼiʻ al-ḥikam, wa-ʻaẓīm al-khulq fī sāʼir aqwālih wa-afʻālih wa-ḥālātih ..."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Secundo folio: wa-ṣifātihi wa-shamāʼilahu lā tustaqṣá.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: 15.5 x 20.7 cm; written surface: 11 x 16.5 cm; 25-27 lines per page.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Binding: Unbound.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with the verses of al-Hamzīyah of al-Būṣīrī in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: On folio 1a: An endowment statement: "Awqafa hādhā al-kitāb lillāh taʻālá Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Najjārī."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, ʻumdat al-muḥaqqiqīn, wa-ruḥalat al-muḥaddithīn, wa-ṣadr al-mudarrisīn, Abī ʻAbd Allāh Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn al-Haythamī, al-shahīr bi-Ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī, saqá Allāh qabrahu bi-al-raḥmah wa-al-ruḍwān wa-askanahu fasīḥ al-jinān. Āmīn. Yā Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: On folio 1a: Biographical information about al-Būṣīrī, and some verses of his poetry, quoted from the commentary of al-Jawjarī (Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim, 1418-1484) on "al-Burdah" (another well-known panegyrical poem by al-Būṣirī priaising the Prophet Muḥammad), stating that al-Būṣīrī died in the year 695 of the Hijrah (1295/1296) at al-Mārastān al-Manṣūrī in Cairo.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: On folio 1b: "... wa-sammaytuhu 'al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah', thumma balaghanī anna al-nāẓim sammāhā 'Umm al-Qurá', tashbīhan la-hā bi-Makkah, bi-jāmiʻ annahā ḥawat bi-ṭarīq al-taṣrīḥ, aw, al-īmāʼ mā fī akthar al-madāʼiḥ, wa-ḥīnaʼidhin sammaytuhu 'Afḍal al-qirā li-qurrāʼ Umm al-Qurá' ..."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: "al-Hamzīyah" of al-Būṣīrī starts with: Kayfa tarqá ruqīyaka al-anbiyāʼu // yā samāʼan mā ṭāwalathā samāʼu. It ends with: Mā aqāma al-ṣalāta man ʻabada Allāha wa-qāmat bi-Rabbihā al-ashyāʼu.

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min itmām hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat khams wa-sabʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá [Allāh] ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-kutiba bi-rasm Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh, al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-zāhid al-wariʻ, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Ismāʻīl, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihimā fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-jaʻalahu huwa wa-salafuhu fī shafāʻat Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ḥsharahumā taḥta liwāʼihi Yawm al-Qiyāmah. Innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr, wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Wa-ghafara Allāh li-man saʻá fī hādhihi al-nuskhah, wa-li-kātibihā, wa-li-man naẓara fī dhālik wa-daʻā bi-khayr. Āmīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Monday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1075 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [6 October, 1664], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. Praise be to God alone. May [God] pray on the one who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Copied for our Master and Lord, the learned scholar, the muftī of the Muslims, the benevolent to the students, our Master Shaykh Aḥmad, the son of our Master and Lord, the learned laboror, the ascetic and righteous scholar, our Master Shaykh Ismāʻīl, may God benefit us with their blessing in this world and the Hereafter. May he and his predecessor be granted the intercession of the Master of the Messengers [Prophet Muḥammad] and be gathered under his banner on the Day of Resurrection. He [God] does what He pleases, and readily answers the requests. May God forgive whoever participated in this copy, its copyist and the reader who offers an invocation of welfare. Amen. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty and All Powerful."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Title from reference sources.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala al-Qurʼān kalāman muʼallafan munaẓẓaman, wa-nazzalahu bi-ḥasab al-maṣāliḥ munajjaman, wa-jaʻalahu bi-al-taḥmīd muftataḥan, wa-bi-al-istiʻādhah mukhtataman, wa-awḥāhu ʻalá qismayn mutashābihan wa-muḥkaman, wa-faṣṣalahu suwaran, wa-suwaruhu āyāt, wa-mayyaza baynahunna bi-fuṣūl wa-ghāyāt, wa-mā hiya illā ṣifāt mubtadiʼ mubtadiʻ, wa-simāt munshiʼ mukhtariʻ, fa-subḥāna man istaʼthara bi-al-awwalīyah wa-al-qidam, wa-wasama kull shayʼ bi-al-ḥudūth ʻan al-ʻadam, anshaʼahu kitāban sāṭiʻan tibyānuhu, qāṭiʻan burhānuhu, waḥyan nāṭiqan bi-bayyināt wa-ḥujaj, Qurʼānan ʻArabīyan ghayr dhī ʻiwaj, miftāḥan lil-manāfiʻ al-dīnīyah wa-al-dunyāwīyah ..."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Secundo folio: wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-Muhājirīn wa-al-Anṣār.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: 18.5 x 28 cm; written surface: 12 x 19.5 cm; 23 lines per page.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Binding: In dark brown leather with flap; central medallion on cover and flap.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: In good naskh/ruqʻah script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; many notes and commentaries on the margins; the titles of the sūrahs within decorative designs, colored in red, blue, black, green and gold; catchwords.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: On the label of the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Tafsīr al-Kashshāf, min al-Fātiḥah li-ghāyat al-Aʻrāf, mudhahhab wa-muṭallā ruʼūs al-suwar."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: At the head of the text on folio 1b: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Lā yamassuhu illā al-muṭahharūn. Tanzīl min Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 1 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Colophon: No colophon. Text ends with: "ʻAn Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayh: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Aʻrāf jaʻala Allāh Yawm al-Qiyāmah baynahu wa-bayna Iblīs saddan, wa-kāna Ādam shafīʻan [la-hu] Yawm al-Qiyāmah."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Title from reference sources.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Incipit: "Sūrat al-Kahf. Makkīyah. Wa-hiya miʼah wa-iḥdá ʻashrata āyah. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Laqqana Allāh ʻibādahu wa-faqqaqahum kayfa yuthnūna ʻalayhi wa-yaḥmadūnahu ʻalá ajzal naʻmāʼihi ʻalayhim, wa-hiya niʻmat al-Islām, wa-mā anzala ʻalá ʻabdihi Muḥammad min al-Kitāb, alladhī huwa sabab najātihim wa-fawzihim, wa-lam yajʻal la-hu ʻiwajan, wa-lam yajʻal la-hu shayʼan min al-ʻiwaj qaṭṭ. Wa-al-ʻiwaj fī al-maʻānī ka-al-ʻiwaj fī al-aʻyān ..."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Secundo folio: Allāh waladan mutaʻalliq bi-al-mundharīn.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: 18.5 x 24.8 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18 cm; 22 lines per page.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Binding: In dark brown leather.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: In good naskh/ruqʻah script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: On folio 1a: Two partially legible ownership statements: 1. "Mālik hādhā al-mamlūk [... ... ...]". 2. "Qad ishtaraytu hādhā al-tafsīr fī [... ... ...]. Seal of "Muḥammad Ismāʻīl".

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 3 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Colophon: No colophon. The work ends with the commentary on Sūrat al-Nās (Chapter 114, the last sūrah of the Qurʼān) and a pious invocation by the author: "Qāla ʻabd Allāh al-faqīr ilayhi: Wa-anā aʻūdh bi-himā [al-Muʻawwidhatayn], wa-bi-jamīʻ kalimāt Allāh al-kāmilah al-tāmmah, wa-alūdhu bi-kanaf raḥmatihi al-shāmilah al-ʻāmmah min kull mā yaklimu al-dīn wa-yathlimu al-yaqīn ... wa-asʼaluhu bi-khuḍūʻ al-ʻunq wa-khushūʻ al-baṣar, wa-bi-mā ʻunītu bi-hi min muhājaratī ilayhi, wa-mujāwaratī wa-murābaṭatī bi-Makkah wa-muṣābaratī ... wa-bi-mā laqītu min kadḥ al-yamīn wa-ʻaraq al-jabīn fī ʻamal al-Kashshāf ... bayna ẓahrānay al-Ḥaram wa-bayna yaday al-Bayt al-Muḥarram, ḥattá waqaʻa al-taʼwīl ḥaythu wujida al-Tanzīl, an yahaba lī khātimat al-khayr, wa-yaqiyanī maṣāriʻ al-sūʼ, wa-yatajāwaza ʻan faraṭātī Yawm al-Tanād, wa-lā yafḍaḥanī bi-hā ʻalá ruʼūs al-ashhād, wa-yaḥullanī Dār al-Maqāmah, min faḍlihi, bi-wāsiʻ ṭawlihi wa-sābigh thawābih. Innahu Huwa al-jawwād al-karīm, al-raʼūf al-raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. (Seal of Muḥammad Ismāʻīl)."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Title from reference sources.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Incipit: "Sūrat al-Aʻrāf Makkīyah, ghayr thamān āyāt: 'Wa-salhum ʻan al-Qaryah' ilá 'Wa-idh nataqnā'. Wa-hiya miʼatān wa-khams āyāt. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Kitāb: Khabar mubtadaʼ maḥdhūf, ay, huwa Kitāb, wa-unzila ilayka ṣifah la-hu, wa-al-murād bi-al-Kitāb al-sūrah, fa-lā yakun fī ṣadrika ḥaraj minhu, ay, shakk minhu, ka-qawlihi: Fa-in kunta fī shakk mimmā anzalnā ilayka, wa-maʻná al-shakk ḥarijan, li-anna al-shākk ḍayyiq al-ṣadr ḥarijuhu, kamā anna al-mutayaqqin munshariḥ al-ṣadr munfasiḥuhu, ay, lā tashukka fī annahu muzal min Allāh, aw, ḥarij min tablīghih, li-annahu kāna yakhāfu qawmahu wa-takdhībahum la-hu wa-iʻrāḍahum ʻanhu wa-adhāhum, fa-kāna yaḍīqu ṣadruhu min al-adāʼ wa-lā yanbasiṭu la-hu, fa-ammanahu Allāh wa-nahāhu min al-mubālāh bi-him ..."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Secundo folio: wa-qalīlan nuṣiba bi-tadhakkarūn.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: 19.5 x 29.5 cm; written surface: 12 x 22 cm; 25 lines per page.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Binding: In brown leather with flap (in 23 unnumbered quires).

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: In beautiful naskh script; in black ink on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and commentaries on the margins; text within double red frame; catchwords.

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: On the label on the front cover: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān lil-Shaykh Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. 1166."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: On folio 1a: "al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Tafsīr al-Qurʼān al-ʻAẓīm, lil-ʻĀlim al-ʻallāmah Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: The commentary on Sūrat al-Kahf ends with: "ʻAn Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Man qaraʼa Sūrat al-Kahf, kadhā, min ākhirihā kānat la-hu nūran min qarnihi ilá qadamih, wa-man qaraʼahā kullahā kānat la-hu nūran min al-arḍ ilá al-samāʼ. Wa-ʻanhu, ʻalayhi al-salām: Man qaraʼa ʻinda maḍjaʻihi: 'Qul innamā anā basharun mithlukum', kāna la-hu fī maḍjaʻihi nūr yatalaʼlaʼu ilá Makkah taḥshū dhālika al-nūr malāʼikah yuṣallūna ʻalayhi ḥattá yaqūm, wa-in kāna maḍjaʻuhu bi-Makkah kāna la-hu nūr yatalaʼlaʼu min maḍjaʻihi ilá al-Bayt, ḥashū dhālika al-nūr malāʼikah yuṣallūna ʻalayhi ḥattá yastayqiẓa ..."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Colophon: "Qad waqaʻa al-farāgh ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻUmar Afandī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, fī yawm al-Jumʻah, rābiʻ ʻishrīn shahr al-Qaʻdah, sanat 1166."

title: 880-03 al-Kashshāf ʻan ḥaqāʼiq al-Tanzīl. Al-Juzʼ 2 : manuscript / Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar al-Zamakhsharī.
note: Translation of the Colophon: "The copy was completed by the hand of the poor to God Almighty, ʻUmar Afandī, may God forgive him and his parents, on Friday, 24 al-Qaʻdah, 1166 [of the Hijrah = 22 September, 1753]."

title: 880-01 Kitāb fī maʻrifat al-burj wa-al-manāzil wa-maʻrifat al-qamar wa-al-awtād : manuscript.

note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhā 'Kitāb fī maʻrifat al-burj wa-al-manāzil wa-maʻrifat al-qamar wa-al-awtād'. Iʻlam innaka idhā aradta an taʻrifa burj al-qamar, fa-unẓur mā maḍá min al-shahr al-ʻArabī wa-zid qadrahu, wa-zidhu khamsah, wa-aʻṭi li-kull burj khamsah, wa-ibtadī min burj al-shams, fa-al-muntahī ilayhi huwa burj al-qamar ..."

note: On folio 1a: A poem in nine verses (in broken Arabic and unbalanced rhythm), by an anonymous author, praising a dignitary named "al-ʻĪsāwī" and his noble Hashemite descent.

title: 880-01 Kitāb fī maʻrifat al-burj wa-al-manāzil wa-maʻrifat al-qamar wa-al-awtād : manuscript.
note: Colophon: No colophon. Text ends abruptly with: "... fa-innahu lā yukmilu sabʻat ayyām ḥattá yará al-ʻajab min al-maṭlūb wa-yaṣīru tibʻan la-hu, kamā yatbaʻu al-walad ummahu, wa-al-kawkab burjahu. Wa-al-āyah hiya: 'ʻAsá Allāh an yajʻala baynakum wa-bayna alladhīna ʻādaytum minhum mawaddah', wa-hiya ṣifat al-khātim, kamā tará al-masʼalah al-thāniyah. Wa-Allāh taʻālá aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ ..."

title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.

title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.

title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh muyassir al-ḥisāb, wa-muhawwin al-ṣiʻāb, wa-musayyir al-ḥussāb, aḥmaduhu ḥamdan yaftaḥu lanā min al-khayrāt kulla bāb, wa-ashkuruhu shukran yaʻṣimunā bi-hi min al-artiyāb, wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādata ʻabdin awwāb, wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu, al-nāṭiq bi-al-ṣawāb, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-jamīʻ al-aṣḥāb. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī: Hādhā mukhtaṣar fī ʻilam al-ḥisāb, yusahhil li-man yurīdu al-shurūʻ fī al-farāʼiḍ min ulī al-albāb, mushtamil ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāthat abwāb wa-khātimah yatimmu bi-hā al-kitāb. Sammaytuhu: Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb ..."

title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.

title: 880-02 Tuḥfat al-aḥbāb fī ʻilm al-ḥisāb : manuscript / Badr al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "What was introduced in sufficient for the beginner. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma iʻānah. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim lil-ṣawāb, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nāṭiq bi-al-ḥikmah wa-faṣl al-khiṭāb, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-kirām wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-man tabiʻahum bi-iḥsān ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, ballaghahu Allāh al-āmāl wa-razaqahu al-tawfīq fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ṭalabah al-mubtadiʼīn an ashraḥa Sullam al-manṭiq sharḥan yakūnu fī ghāyat al-līn wa-an lā azīda ʻalá ḥall alfāẓihi, li-yaẓfara bi-fahm maʻnāh man huwa min ḥuffāẓihi, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālik mustaʻīnan bi-al-Qādir al-Mālik, musammiyan īyāhu bi-Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam, ṭāliban min al-Samīʻ al-Baṣīr an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr ..."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Secundo folio: al-afhām wa-Allāh ʻalam ʻalá al-dhāt al-wājib al-wujūd.

note: Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā kitābatahu. Nasʼalu Man waffaqanā la-hu an yanfaʻa [bi-hi]. Innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Tamma al-sharḥ. Wa-Allāh aʻlam."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to write. We ask Him who enabled us for what we accomplished to benefit [us] by it. He is able on doing this. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. The commentary is concluded. God is more knowledgeable.

title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.

title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.
note: Incipit: The beginning of the manuscript is missing. The text starts with: "... minhu dalālah mā, wa-laysa maʻa hādhā bi-muṭṭaridah, mithl anna al-nawʻ al-wāḥid in kānat la-hu aṣnāf mukhtalifah fa-abyaḍuhā abraduhā, wa-alladhī minhā aḥmar aw aswad aḥarruhā, mithl inna hādhā ayḍan laysa bi-mustamirr fī kull al-anwāʻ, fa-iʻlam dhālik. Kam hiya al-ashyah [al-ashyāʼ] allatī iḍṭarrat al-aṭibāʼ ilá tarkīb al-adwiyah al-mufradah? Sittah: Aḥaduhā, ikhtilāf maqādīr al-amrāḍ; wa-al-thānī, ikhtilāf jihāt istiʻmāl al-adwiyah; wa-al-thālith, taṭyīb ṭaʻm al-dawāʼ li-yashula shurbuhu ..."

title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.
note: Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-masāʼil al-ṭibbīyah al-mushtamilah ʻalá jumal min ʻilm al-ṭibb, quṣida bi-hā li-takūna madkhalan lil-mubtadī wa-tadhkirah lil-muntahī. Wa-fī dhālika kifāyah. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.
note: Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of the medical issues which included miscellaneous aspects of the science of medicine, intended to be an introduction to the beginner and a memorandum to the accomplished. Enough said. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. Amen. It is concluded."

title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.
note: Copyist's colophon: "Tamma Kitāb 'Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb', masʼalah wa-jawāb, fī khamsah min Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-ḥarām alladhī huwa min shuhūr <khamsah> sittah wa-sabʻīn baʻda al-miʼatayn wa-al-alf bi-ʻawn Allāh taʻālá wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-sallam."

title: 880-02 Intikhāb al-Iqtiḍāb : manuscript / Saʻīd ibn Abī al-Khayr ibn al-Masīḥī.
note: Translation of the copyist's colophon: "The book of 'Selection from the Compendium', in the form of question and answer, was completed on 5 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1276 [of the Hijrah = 25 May, 1860] by the help of God Almighty and His abundant benevolence. May God Almighty pray on our Master Muḥammad and his family and grant them peace."

title: 880-02 al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb : manuscript / ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Inna aḥaqq mā yatazayyanu bi-nashrihi manṭiq al-qāṣī wa-al-ḥāḍir, wa-yatawashshaḥ bi-dhikrihi ṣudūr al-kutub wa-al-dafātir, ḥamd Allāh, jalla jalāluh, ʻalá al-āyah al-muzhirat al-riyāḍ, wa-shukruhu, ʻamma nawāluh, ʻalá naʻmāʼihi al-mutraʻat al-ḥiyāḍ, alladhī sharrafa nawʻ al-insān bi-ḥilyat al-idrāk, wa-zaīnat al-ifhām, wa-khaṣṣaṣahu bi-idrāj durar al-maʻānī fī jawāhir al-alfāẓ ʻalá sharṭ al-intiẓām ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-ghanī ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī ... lammā raʼaytu al-mukhtaṣar al-musammá bi-al-Tahdhīb, al-mansūb ilá ... Saʻd al-Millah wa-al-Dīn Masʻūd al-Taftāzānī ... kitāban mushtamilan ʻalá akthar masāʼil al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah fī tamhīd al-qawāʻid al-manṭiqīyah ... sharaḥtuhu sharḥan yubayyinu muʻḍilātih wa-yufassiru mushkilātih ... wasamtuhu bi-al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb ..."

title: 880-02 al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb : manuscript / ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī.
note: In fair naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Tahdhīb in red; few notes on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb : manuscript / ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī.
note: Author's colophon: "Hādhā ākhir mā aradnā īrādahu fī 'Sharḥ' al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb ... Thumma jazā Allāh khayran man taʼammala ṣanʻatī wa-qābala mā fīhā min al-sahw bi-al-ʻafw, wa-aṣlaḥa mā akhṭaʼtu fīhi bi-faḍlihi wa-fiṭnatih. Wa-astaghfiru Allāh min sahwī, fa-innī muʻtarif bi-qillat al-biḍāʻah wa-rijlī fī miḍmār tilka al-ṣināʻah, idh lam yatayassar ilayya al-iṭṭilāʻ ʻalá al-kutub al-manṭiqīyah illā ʻalá 'Sharḥ al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah', wa-istakhrajtu minhu al-masāʼil ʻalá ḥasb dhihnī wa-dahāʼī, wa-istafadtu minhu al-fawāʼid ʻalá qadr fahmī wa-dhakāʼī, fa-katabtuhā fī hādhā al-kitāb bi-tabṣirah li-man tabaṣṣar, wa-tadhkirah li-man arāda an yatadhakkar. Wa-Allāh al-mustaʻān wa-ʻalayhi al-tiklān. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 al-Tadhhīb fī sharḥ al-Tahdhīb : manuscript / ʻUbayd Allāh ibn Faḍl Allāh al-Khabīṣī.
note: Translation of the author's colophon: "This is the end of what we wanted to introduce of the 'Commentary' on the book. God is more knowledgeable of what is correct, to Him is the reference and returning ... Also, may God reward well him who investigates my work and forgives what he finds of inattentiveness, or corrects what mistakes I made, according to his favor and perspicacity. I ask God's forgiveness for any forgetfulness, and admit my meager knowledge and the lack of the agility of my leg in the arena of this art; as I was not able to inspect the books on logic, except 'the Commentary on al-Risālah al-Shamsīyah', of which I extracted the issues according to my mind and intelligence, and acquired benefits from it according to my understanding and acumen, which I recorded in this book, as an instruction for him who wants to ponder, and a memorandum for him who wants to remember. Help comes from God, and on Him is the reliance. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Title from incipit (folio 1b).

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim lil-ṣawāb, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nāṭiq bi-al-ḥikmah wa-faṣl al-khiṭāb, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-kirām wa-al-tābiʻīn, wa-man tabiʻahum ʻalá al-dawām. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Aḥmad al-Damanhūrī, ballaghahu Allāh al-āmāl wa-razaqahu al-tawfīq fī al-aqwāl wa-al-afʻāl: Qad saʼalanī baʻḍ al-ṭalabah al-mubtadiʼīn an ashraḥa Sullam al-manṭiq sharḥan yakūnu fī ghāyat al-līn, wa-an lā azīda ʻalá ḥall alfāẓihi, li-yaẓfara bi-fahm maʻnāhu man huwa min ḥuffāẓihi, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālika, mustaʻīnan bi-al-Qādir al-Mālik, musammaiyan la-hu bi-Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam, ṭāliban min al-Samīʻ al-Baṣīr an yanfaʻa bi-hi kamā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi, innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr ..."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Secundo folio: wa-al-nisbah bayna al-thalāthah fī risālatinā.

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; the verses of "al-Sullam" and markings in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Author's colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnā kitābatahu. Nasʼalu Man waffaqanā la-hu an yanfaʻa bi-hi. Innahu ʻalá dhālika qadīr. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Copyist's colophon: "Waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābatihi yawm al-Ithnayn, fī khāmis ʻashar yawman min shahr Ṣafar, sanat 1194, arbaʻah wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf."

title: 880-02 Īḍāḥ al-mubham min maʻānī al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Munʻim al-Damanhūrī.
note: Translation of the copyist's colophon: "Copied on Monday, 15 Ṣafar, 1194 [of the Hijrah = 21 February, 1780]."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Title from folio 1a.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-ʻālim bi-al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt, al-hādī lil-ʻuqūl ilá ḥall ṣiʻāb al-maʻqūl bi-ṭuruq iktisāb al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, al-jāmiʻ li-ajnās al-kamālāt wa-al-faḍāyil, al-mukhtār min afḍal al-anwāʻ wa-al-[...?] ashraf aṣnāf al-urūmāt wa-al-qabāʼil, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi [...] dhawī al-ʻuqūl al-zakīyah wa-ṣāʼibī al-anẓār, wa-ʻalá al-tābiʻīn wa-man tabiʻahum bi-iḥsān min dhawī al-anwār wa-badīʻ al-asrār. Ammā baʻd, fa-qad kuntu sharaḥtu fīmā maḍá kitāb al-Sullam sharḥan badīʻ al-itqān, mushtamilan ʻalá farāʼid al-taḥqīqāt wa-nikāt al-tadqīqāt wa-badāʼiʻ al-ʻirfān, dhallaltu fīhi ṣiʻāb al-mushkilāt ʻalá ṭarīq al-tamām, wa-istakhrajtu minhu mustawdaʻāt asrār wa-ẓarāʼif afhām, wa-ẓafirtu minhu bi-daqāʼiq anẓār wa-mukhabbaʼāt asrār, ihtadaytu fīhi ʻalá gharāʼib nikāt wa-ʻarāʼis abkār, thumma raʼaytu anna al-himam al-ān qad qaṣurat, wa-al-ʻuqūl fī hādhā al-zamān qad taballadat wa-takaddarat, fa-ṣaraftu al-himmah thāniyan naḥwa al-ikhtiṣār wa-al-iqtiṣār ʻalá al-taḥqīqāt wa-nabdh al-aghyār, māzijan lil-sharḥ bi-al-shurūḥ imtizāj al-māʼ bi-al-rāḥ wa-al-jasad bi-al-rūḥ ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Secundo folio: fīmā akhrajahu al-aʼimmah.

note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb sharḥ al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Mullawī al-Shāfiʻī ʻalá matn al-Sullam fī ʻilm al-manṭiq."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Sharḥ al-Sullam, lil-Shaykh al-Mullawī, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-hi. Āmīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk ʻabduhu al-faqīr Nablālī, ghafara Allāh la-hu."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah yawm al-Thalāth al-mubārak, li-sittah (6) khalat min shuhūr alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-tisʻīn, sanat 1198 min al-Jihrah [al-Hijrah] al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This copy was written on blessed Tuesday, six having passed from the months of the year 1198 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [probably 6 Jumādá al-Thāniyah, 1198 = 27 April, 1784], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Titles of the two treaises from reference sources.

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Incipit of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā Kitāb al-ṭīb [al-ṭibb] al-kīmiyāwī alladhī ikhtaraʻahu Baraklistūsh [Barākalsūs: Paracelsus, 1493-1541], yashmalu ʻalá muqaddimāt wa-maqālāt. al-Muqaddimah al-ūlá fī taʻrīf al-kīmiyāʼ, wa-li-bayān al-ḥājah ilayhā, wa-al-gharaḍ minhā. Fa-naqūlu: al-Kīmiyāʼ lafẓ Yūnānī, fī aṣlihi khimiyā, wa-maʻnāhu al-taḥlīl wa-al-tafrīq, wa-baʻḍ al-nās yuṭliqu ʻalayhā al-ṣināʻah al-Hirmisīyah. Wa-qāla qawm: Yuṭlaqu ʻalayhā amr al-kahanah. Wa-awwal min ightaraʻahā [ikhtaraʻahā] huw Hirmis al-Thulth [al-Muthallath] al-Miṣrī, wa-ʻallamahā al-kahanah. Wa-baʻd dhālika shāʻat ḥattá waṣalat ilá al-Yūnān, wa-ṣannafū fī dhālika kutuban wa-rasāʼil, ilá al-Islāmīyīn, wa-allafū fīhā kutuban kathīrah wa-rasāʼil ʻadīdah. Wa-al-maqṣūd min dhālika iṣlāḥ al-maʻdin [al-maʻādin] wa-taghyīrihā min al-fasād ilá al-ṣalāḥ, ka-qalb al-nuḥās fiḍḍah wa-al-fiḍḍah dhahaban, ilá an jāʼa Barākāshūsh al-Ḥirāfī [Barākalsūs al-Jirmānī], fa-ghayyara al-gharaḍ min ṣināʻat al-kīmiyāʼ, wa-jaʻalahu min aqsām ṣanʻat al-ṭibb, wa-sammāhu istāgharā bi-al-Lātīnīyah, wa-maʻnāhu jamʻ al-mukhallafāt wa-tafrīquhā, wa-hādhā al-ism makhṣūṣ bi-ṣināʻat al-ṭibb al-kīmiyāʼī ..."

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Secundo folio of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": wa-al-kīmiyāʼ al-ṭayyibah [al-ṭibbīyah] wa-qad tuṭlaqu al-kīmiyāʼ ʻalá al-ḥikmah.

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Incipit of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ʻalá manbaʻ al-ḥikmah fī al-ʻālamīn, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi alladhīna iqtabasū min mishkāt nūrih, fa-hum hudāt al-dīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-qad allafa fī ṣināʻat al-ṭibb al-kīmiyāʼī Faraliyūsh [Qarūliliyūs: Croll, Oswald, approximately 1560-1609] kitāban mukhtaṣaran mufīdan li-malik zamānih, wa-huwa yashmalu ʻalá maqālatayn, fa-aradnā an nanqulahu min al-Lātīnīyah ilá al-ʻArabīyah, li-yakun [li-yakūna] bihā tamām al-nafʻ, wa-sammá hādhā al-kitāb Kimiyā nalīqā [bāsilīqā], yaʻnī al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah ..."

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Secundo folio of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": min al-akhlāṭ al-fāsidah.

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: 16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 21-26 lines per page.

note: Binding: In cardboard binding with flap; dark brown leather on the edges (in four unnumbered quires).

note: In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and keywords in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: "[... ...] Abū Ghazālah". "Tamallaka hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr Fatʹḥ Allāh Abū Ghazālah, ʻufiya ʻanhu".

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Colophon of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": "... Wa-hādhā ākhir mā ikhtarnāhu wa-naqalnāhu min kitāb Shinārtūsh al-Ḥirāfī [Sināritūs al-Jirmānī: Daniel Sennert, 1572-1637], alladhī fī ṣināʻat al-ṭbb, wa-min Qarabādīn Wāfarbūsh [Wāqiriyūs: Johann Jacob Wecker, 1528-1586] min [fī] taqṭīr al-arwāḥ wa-al-adʹhān. Wa-bi-hi tamma al-kitāb. Wa-Allāh al-mahdī ilá al-ṣawāb, wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Translation of the colophon of "al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī": "This is the end of what we selected and translated from the book of Senartus the Germanic [Daniel Sennert, 1572-1637], which is about the profession of medicine, and from Qarabādīn (Pharmaceutics) of Wāqirbūs [Wāqiryūs: Johann Jacob Wecker, 1528-1586] about the distillation of spirits and oils, by which the book is concluded. God is the one who guides to what is correct. To Him is the reference and returning. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Amen. Amen."

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Colophon of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. H."

title: 880-03 al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kīmiyāʼī : manuscript / Ṣāliḥ ibn Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm al-Ḥalabī.
note: Translation of the colophon of "Kīmiyāʼ bāsilīqā (or, al-Kimiyāʼ al-malakīyah)": "God is more knowledgeable. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on him who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. H."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Title from reference sources.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Incipit: The first leaf is missing. Starts with: "... Abtadá [Abtadī], aw, ibtidāʼī, aw, uʼallifu, aw, taʼlīfī. Wa-ibtadaʼa bi-al-Basmalah taʼassiyan bi-al-Qurʼān al-ʻazīz, wa-imtithālan li-muqtaḍá qawlihi, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fīmā akhrajahu al-aʼimmah 'Kull amr dhī bāl lā bubdaʼu fīhi bi-bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm fa-huwa ajdham', ay, maqṭūʻ al-barakah, wa-fī riwāyah 'bi-ḥamd Allāh', rawāhu Abū Dāwūd wa-ghayruhu, wa-ḥassanahu Ibn al-Ṣalāḥ wa-ghayruhu ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Secundo folio: alladhī ka-al-saḥāb wa-min bayānīyah.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: 16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 9 x 14.5 cm; 17 lines per page.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Binding: Unbound.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; the phrases of al-Sullam in red; some commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Colophon: "Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Fattāḥ al-Mullawī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. Praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Title supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Naḥmaduka yā man afāḍa ʻalá riyāḍ ʻuqūlinā ghuyūth saḥāʼib al-taṣawwurāt wa-al-taṣdīqāt, wa-aṭlaʻa fī samāwāt baṣāʼirinā shumūs maʻrifat al-kullīyāt wa-al-juzʼīyāt. Wa-nashhadu an lā ilāha illā anta waḥdaka, lā sharīka lak, al-munʻim ʻalá ajnās al-makhlūqāt bi-anwāʻ al-hibāt. Wa-nashhadu anna Sayyidanā Muḥammadan ʻabduka wa-rasūluk al-mabʻūth bi-al-burhān al-wāḍiḥ wa-al-qawl al-shāriḥ wa-al-āyāt al-bayyināt, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi mā tarannamat ashkāl al-ghuṣūn bi-anfās al-nasamāt, wa-afṣaḥa dhū manṭiq ʻammā fī khazāʼin ḍamīrihi min al-mukawwināt. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī al-ghufrān Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān, aḥsana Allāh ʻamalah wa-ballaghahu fī al-dārayn amalah: Lammā manna al-Mawlá al-laṭīf ʻalá hādhā al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf bi-qirāʼat al-Sharḥ al-ṣaghīr ʻalá al-Sullam li-Shaykhinā al-ruḥalah al-Ustādh al-Mullawī, ʻalá muʼallafihi wa-ʻalayhi ruḍwān al-Rabb al-akram, wa-bi-qrāʼī dhālika al-kitāb li-jamm ghafīr min maharat al-ṭullāb, wa-taḥaṣṣala minhā mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min taqrīrāt sharīfah wa-taḥqīqāt badīʻah munīfah wa-nikāt almaʻīyah wa-daqāʼiq lawdhaʻīyah naẓamtuhā fī silk al-taṣnīf wa-jaʻaltuhā ḥāshiyah ʻalá hādhā al-Sharḥ al-munīf ..."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Secundo folio: wa-tasāhala fī mawāḍiʻ kathīrah.

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: 16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 25-30 lines per page.

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; black cloth on spine and flap (in nine numbered quires).

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: In good naskh script (except quire 9 which is written in fair naskh/ruqʻah script), in black ink, on white paper; many commentaries on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: On folio 1a: "Ḥāshiyat al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-ḥabr al-baḥr al-fahhāmah al-Shaykh al-Ṣabbān ʻalá Mullawī al-Sullam. Manṭiq."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Author's colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu: Tamma tabyīḍ hādhihi al-Ḥāshiyah ʻalá yad muʼallifihā al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Mawlāh, Muḥammad al-Ṣabbān, ʻāmalahu Allāh bi-al-ghufrān wa-al-iḥsān, wa-kāna tamām tabyīḍihā yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ li-arbaʻ layālin baqiyat min shahr Muḥarram al-ḥarām, ifttitāḥ sanat 1197, sabʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-atamm al-salām."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Translation of the author's colophon: "Its author said: The fair copy of this Gloss was completed by the hand of its author, the poor to the mercy of his Lord, Muḥammad al-Ṣabbān, may God bestow upon him forgiveness and favor, having been completed on Wednesday, four nights remaining from the month of Muḥarram, the beginning of the year 1197 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [1 January, 1783], may the best prayer and the most perfect peace be upon Him."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Copyist's colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābatihā yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ ayḍan, baʻda al-ẓuhr, tāsiʻ ʻashar yawm maḍá min shahr Rabīʻ al-Thānī, ʻaqiba mawlid Sayyidinā al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, sanat 1225, khamsah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf, ʻalá yad kātibihā, bi-yadihi al-fāniyah, al-ʻabd al-faqīr al-muʻtarif bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻAlī al-Bārī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Farghalī al-Anṣārī nasaban al-Khazrajī qabīlatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ṭahṭāʼī baladan al-Azʹharī iqāmatan, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-mashāyikhihi wa-li-muḥbbīhi wa-li-man naẓara fīhi wa-daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah, wa-li-man wajada ʻayban wa-aṣlaḥahu. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-sallam."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī al-Ṣabbān.
note: Translation of the copyist's colophon: "It was copied also on Wednesday, in the afternoon, 19 days having passed from the month of Rabīʻ al-Thānī, after the birthday of our Master al-Imām al-Ḥusayn, in the year 1225 [of the Hijrah = 24 May, 1810], by the perishing hand of its copyist, the poor servant, who admits his inability and his insufficiency, he who hopes for the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord the Creator, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Farghalī al-Anṣārī nasaban al-Khazrajī qabīlatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ṭahṭāʼī baladan al-Azʹharī iqāmatan, may God forgive him, his parents, his teachers, his loved ones, him who looks into it and invokes God to forgive him and have mercy upon him, and him who finds a blemish in it and corrects it. May God prey on our Master Muḥammad and grant him peace."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Title from folio 1a.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Allāhumma lā sahl illā mā jaʻaltahu sahlan. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala qulūb al-ʻulamāʼ samāwāt tatajallá fīhā shumūs al-maʻārif, wa-wassaʻa dawāyir afhāmihim fa-awlajahum qibāb al-mukhaddarāt min ʻarāyis al-maʻānī wa-al-laṭāyif, wa-ḥabāhum bi-ḥadāyiq al-ʻuqūl fa-tanāwalū min thamarātihā, fa-aṣbaḥt āfāq ʻuqūlihim mushriqah bi-aqmār al-ʻulūm, fa-fāqū man ʻadāhum min al-wará, wa-istaqwaw ʻalá dhurá al-majd wa-ʻalaw ʻalá manābir al-ʻizz bimā sabaqa lahum fī al-Kitāb al-marqūm, fa-tāhū fī riḥāb al-ʻilm wa-ʻaraṣāt al-fahm ʻalá bisāṭ ḥujaj al-maʻqūl ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Secundo folio: ṭalaban li-taḥqīq al-manqūl.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: 13 x 20 cm; written surface: 7 x 13.5 cm; 17 lines per page.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap (in 5 numbered quires).

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: In fair naskh script, in black ink, on light bluish-green paper; few notes on the margisn; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: On folio 1a: "Sharḥ al-Sullam lil-Akhḍarī. Sharḥ al-Sullam lil-Akhḍarī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: On folio 2a: "Wa-baʻd, fa-lammā waḍaʻtu al-urjūzah al-musammāh bi-'al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq', wa-jāt [wa-jāʼat], bi-ḥamd Allāh, jumlatan [jumaluhu] kāfiyah, wa-li-maqāṣid <fī fann ʻilm> fannihā ḥāwiyah, rāwadanī baʻḍ al-ikhwān min al-ṭalabah, akramahum Allāh, al-marrah baʻda al-marrah, ʻalá an aḍaʻa ʻalyahā sharḥan mufīdan yabuththu mā inṭawat ʻalayhi min al-maʻānī, wa-yashīdu mā taqāṣara fīhā min al-mabānī, fa-ajabtuhu li-dhālika ṭalaban [ṭāliban] min Allāh ḥusn al-tawfīq ilá manābiʻ al-taḥqīq, wa-in kuntu lastu ahlan li-dhālik, wa-lākin ḥamalanī ʻalayhi tafāwulī. Wa-lam aḍaʻhu li-man huwa aʻlá minnī, bal li-amthālī min al-mubtadʼīn. Fa-Allāh Allāh, yā akhī al-iʻtidhār wa-tark al-iʻtirāḍ ʻalá al-muʼminīn, wa-iltamis al-ʻudhr li-akhīka al-muʼmin, wa-sāl [wa-sal] Allāh ilayhi fī al-duʻāʼ wa-li-wālidayya bi-al-maghfirah wa-al-raḥmah, raḥimaka Allāh taʻālá. Wa-Allāh walī al-tawfīq ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: On folio 2b: The text of 'al-Sullam al-murawnaq fī ʻilm al-manṭiq' starts with: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī qad akhraja // natāʼij al-fikr li-arbāb al-ḥijā ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnihi wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-kāna al-farāgh minhā [min] kitābat hādhā al-sharḥ al-ʻaẓīm yawm al-Ithnayn, khams ʻashar Shaʻbān al-mubārak, alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat tisʻah wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf, ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajihā [wa-aḥwajihim] ilá Rabbihi al-Jawwād, Ibrāhīm Ḥasan Amīn al-Dīn, ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu, wa-ghafara la-hu wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Sullam : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad al-Akhḍarī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "It is completed by the praise of God, His help and His abundant benevolence. This great commentary was concluded on Monday, the fifteenth of blessed Shaʻbān, of the year 1229 [of the Hijrah = 2 August, 1814], by the hand of the poorest of mankind and the neediest to his Benevolent Lord, Ibrāhīm Ḥasan Amīn al-Dīn, may God pardon him and forgive him who offers and invocation for his forgiveness. Amen."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Title of "al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qafīyah" from reference sources.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Title of "Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah" from incipit (folio 17b).

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Incipit of al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-lil-shiʻr mīzānun yusammá ʻarūḍahu // bi-hā al-naqṣ wa-al-rujḥān yadrīhimā al-fatá. Wa-anwāʻuhu qul khamsataʻshara kulluhā // tuʼallafu min juzʼayni farʻayni lā siwá ..."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Secundo folio of the al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qafīyah: Wa-qul watidun in zidta ḥarfan bilā imtirā.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Incipit of Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waḍaʻa ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ li-yuʻrafa bi-hi awzān al-manẓūm, wa-jaʻala afkāranā qāfiyah li-āthār al-ʻulamāʼ bi-al-manṭūq wa-al-mafhūm, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyid al-Mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ ʻalá al-Khazrajīyah al-manẓūmah ʻalá baḥr al-ṭawīl fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qawāfī, naẓm al-ʻallāmah Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Abī Muḥammad ʻAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad al-Khazrajī al-Mālikī al-Andalusī, yaḥullu alfāẓahā wa-yubayyinu murādahā wa-yaftaḥu rumūzahā, wa-sammaytuhu bi-Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah. Wa-Allāh asʼalu an yanfaʻa bi-hi wa-yajʻalahu khāliṣan li-wajhihi ..."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Secundo folio of "Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: ālah yuʻrafu bi-hā miqdār.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Incipit of Treatise on the new meters in Arabic poetry (folio 79a): "Fāʼidah. Baḥr al-mutadārak istakhrajahu al-Akhfash min baḥr al-mutaqārib, wa-ikhtalafa fīhi ʻan al-Khalīl; fa-qāla al-akthar: 'Naṣṣa ʻalá ṭarḥihi wa-laysa ʻindahu shiʻran [shiʻrun].' Wa-qāla qawm: 'Lam yamnaʻhu wa-lam yuthbithu, immā li-annahu lam yablughhu, wa-tadārakahu al-Akhfash, wa-li-hādhā summiya al-mutadārak' ..."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Secundo folio of Treatise on the new meters in Arabic poetry: wa-qīla dakhalahu al-qaṭʻ wa-jarat al-ʻillah fīhi majrá al-zuḥāf.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Incipit of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān (folio 81a): "Wa-hādhihi abyāt tajmaʻu ʻarūḍ al-abḥur al-sittata ʻashar, bi-istishhād bi-āyāt min al-Qurʼān al-Karīm lil-Bīr, raḥimahu Allāh wa-raḍiya ʻanhu: Ṭawīl. Ṭawīlun madá al-hijrān man kuntu ahwāhu // adhāba fuʼādī wa-al-taṣabburu afnāhu. Faʻūlun mafāʻīlun faʻūlun mafāʻilun // wa-lā taqtulu al-nafsa allatī ḥarrama Allāhu ..."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Secundo folio of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān: Mustafʻilun fāʻilun mustafʻilun faʻilun.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: 9 x 12.5 cm; written surface for al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah: 5 x 7.5 cm; 7 lines per page. Written surface for Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: 5 x 7.5 cm; 13 lines per page.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Binding: In dark brown leather binding; cover heavily damaged.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red and blue; some notes on the margins; some wormholes; no catchwords.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: On folio 1a: "al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah fī al-qawānīn al-ʻarūḍīyah, taʼlīf al-Shaykh Ḍiyāʼ al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Andalusī al-Khazrajī, raḥimahu Allāh. Āmīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: On folio 1a: Four verses on poetry naming the fifteen classical meters of Arabic poetry, and a note stating that the sixteenth meter "al-Mutadārak" was mentioned by al-Akhfash (al-Akhfash al-Awsaṭ, Saʻīd ibn Masʻadah, died approximately 830).

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: On folio 1a: An ownership statement: "Mulk al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Tadmurī."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: On folio 28a: A collation and correction note: "Balagha muqābalatan wa-qirāʼatan wa-taṣḥīḥan min Mawlānā wa-Sayyidinā al-Shaykh al-fāḍil wa-al-baḥr al-zākhir, ḥāwī al-kamālāt wa-al-faḍāʼil, al-Shaykh Yaḥyá al-Faraḍī al-Shāfiʻī, ḥafiẓahu Allāh [Probably: Yaḥyá ibn Taqī al-Dīn al-Faraḍī, active 1619]. Katabahu al-faqīr Muḥammad Shaʻʻāl."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah ends with: "... Wa-qad kamult sittan wa-tisʻīna fa-alladhī // tawassaʻa fī dhā al-ʻilmi tūsiʻuhu ḥubbā. Wa-yasʼalu ʻAbdu Allāhi dhā al-Khazrajīyu min // muṭāliʻihā itḥāfahu minhu bi-al-duʻā."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Half of folio 84 is torn up. On folio 84b are written some verses of poetry in Maghribi script.

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Colophon of al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah: "Tammat. Katabahā Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, ʻufiya ʻanhu."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Translation of the colophon of al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah: "It is completed. Copied by Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, may he be pardoned."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Colophon of Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah (folio 79a): "Tamma Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah fī salkh shahr Ramaḍān, yawm al-Thalāth, min sanat ithnayn wa-sabʻīn wa-tisʻimiʼah bi-al-Mashhad al-Aqdas, ʻalá musharrifihi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām, ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, ʻafá Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu. Āmīn."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Translation of the colophon of Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah: "Fatḥ Rabb al-Barīyah bi-sharḥ al-Qaṣīdah al-Khazrajīyah was completed at the end of the month of Ramaḍān, on Tuesday, of the year 972 [of the Hijrah = 11 May, 1565], at al-Mashhad al-Aqdas, may prayer and peace be upon him who dignified it by his presence [Probably the eight Shiʻī Imām, ʻAlī al-Riḍā ibn Mūsá, died 818 or 819], by the hand of the poor servant Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥurr, may God pardon him. Amen."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Colophon of Treatise on the new meters in Arabic poetry. No colophon. Text ends with: "... wa-hādhihi al-abḥr al-thalāthah takhruju min dāʼirat al-mutashābih. Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Colophon of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān: "Tammat."

title: 880-03 al-Rāmizah fī ʻilmay al-ʻarūḍ wa-al-qāfiyah : manuscript / ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUthmān al-Khazrajī.
note: Translation of the colophon of Treatise on the sixteen classical meters of Arabic poetry including phrases quoted from the Qurʼān: "It is completed."

title: 880-03 Dīwān : manuscript / Abū Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī.
note: Title from incipit.

title: 880-03 Dīwān : manuscript / Abū Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-03 Dīwān : manuscript / Abū Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhā 'Dīwān' nādirat al-falak wa-wāsiṭat ʻiqd al-dahr fī ṣināʻat al-shiʻr, naẓm al-Imām al-humām al-ḥādhiq al-fahhām, al-ʻālim al-ʻallām, al-Shaykh Abī Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī. Ḥarf al-Hamzah. Qāla yamdaḥu Khālid ibn Yazīd al-Shaybānī, wa-hādhā ʻalá al-tartīb alladhī rattabahu Abū Bakr al-Ṣūlī, wa-jaʻalahu thamāniyat aṣnāf: Yā mawḍiʻa al-Shadanīyati al-wajnāʼi // wa-muṣāriʻa al-īlāj wa-al-isrāʼi. Addi al-salāma muʻarrifan wa-muḥaṣṣiban // min Khālidi al-maʻrūfi wa-al-hayjāʼi ..."

title: 880-03 Dīwān : manuscript / Abū Tammām Ḥabīb ibn Aws al-Ṭāʼī.

title: Correspondence, 1851-1897.
note: Letters to J. D. Tomlinson regarding some of Cooper's pictures of landscapes, cows, and sheep; with dimensions, prices, and buyers noted for some of the paintings. The majority (8) are written from Vernon Holme, Harbledowne; three are written from London. Two items are sketches on Royal Academy of Arts stationery, London, dated 1853 and 1897. One item is a note from Alfred Crowquill [i.e. Alfred Henry Forrester] with a sketch and a request for Cooper's autograph. With one envelope addressed to J. D. Tomlinson, Huddersfield, October, 1865. In all there are three sketches in graphite and four in pen and ink. Cooper's sketches depict cows and sheep, Crowquill's sketch shows a jester holding a placard.

title: Letter, 1861 Dec. 27.
note: Letter to Reverend Richard Glover, dated December 27, 1861, from 1 Tor Villa, Campden Hill, Kensington. In the letter Hunt expresses his gratitude for Glover's study of his painting "The Light of the World" and discusses the meaning and origin of the painting's title. After seeing the painting in 1861, Glover wrote his interpretation of the work, entitled "The Light of the Word", or Holman Hunt's great allegorical picture, translated into words; that was published during the same year.

title: Letter, 1855 Nov. 29.
note: Letter addressed to James Salmon from 9 Argyle Place in which Jones acknowledges Salmon's invitation to lecture to the Council of the Architectural Institute. Written on paper stamped with the crest of de la Rue & Co. for whom Jones did design work.

title: Letter, 1812 Aug. 20.
note: Letter addressed to David Stewart, Earl of Buchan, dated August 20, 1812, regarding a new mechanical method of reproducing "fine engravings." The letter does not specify how the new method works, but Stanhope explains various machinery needed to complete the reproductive process and promises to send Stewart "some admirable specimens, together with a printed description of the whole process."

title: Letters, 27 and 28 Feb. 1846.

title: Letter; 1942.
note: Letter to Hilda Caroline, Stanley Spencer's first wife, dated July 5, 1942, from Ladywood, Grasmere, Westmorland, mainly regarding Sir William Rothenstein. Illustrated with two pen and ink and colored crayon sketches of Rothenstein working on a portrait of Lord Cowdray. Spencer also discusses the fate of his "Home Guard" drawings, mentions Paul Nash, and comments on his wartime activities.

title: Della architettura militare : manuscript.
note: Catalog record based on a description of the manuscript by Morgan Ng. See citation herewith.

title: Trattato di architectura civile e militare.
note: "Aside from his additions to the ducal palaces at Urbino and Gubbio, it is [Francesco's] work as military architect for which he is renowned. The defenses that he designed for the duchy of Montefeltro are among the first attempts to build fortifications capable of withstanding cannon shot while being defended by flanking fire, in the manner that would ultimately lead to the fully realized angle bastions of the sixteenth century. Francesco deals substantially with fortification in the penultimate book of his Trattato. Like Vitruvius, he saw the art as an integral component of classical building tradition. Francesco's drawings show many forms of fortification, but few of these are fully effective or efficient. ... Francesco's writings were never published in his lifetime. The Trattato remained in manuscript form, surviving in several different versions, which date to essentially two different periods of his career. This copy was based on a later composition, completed sometime after 1482. While the drawings are at least partly in Francesco's hand, the text was written by copyists sometime around 1520."--Compass and rule : architecture as mathematical practice in early modern England, 1550-1750.

title: Trattato di architectura civile e militare.
note: The present manuscript is a copy of the second version of the treatise. It is not listed in Gustina Scaglia, Francesco di Giorgio: Checklist and History of Manuscripts and Drawings in Autographs and Copies from ca. 1470 to 1687 and Renewed Copies (1764-1839) (London and Toronto: Associated University Presses, 1992). Of the manuscripts published in Francesco di Giorgio Martini, Trattati di architettura, ingegneria e arte militare, ed. Corrado Maltese (Milan: Il Polifilo, 1967), it is most closely related to the version in Florence, Biblioteca Nazionale Centrale di Firenze, ex-Magliabecchianus II.I.141. There are still many variations within the text. The version of the text in Magliabecchinus II.I.141 was probably completed about 1492; see Richard J. Betts, “On the Chronology of Francesco di Giorgio's Treatises: New Evidence from an Unpublished Manuscript”, Journal of the Society of Architectural Historians 36:1 (1977), p.13.

title: Trattato di architectura civile e militare.
note: Written in Italy in the 16th century. On f. 89v is a note with the year 1521, giving a terminus ad quem for the manuscript.

title: Trattato di architectura civile e militare.

note: Completed in pen and ink.

title: [Tax bill for Samuel Staneforth Esqr of Attercliff [illegible] Darnall, dated July 12, 1814]
note: "No. 10. Affixed taxes, 1st part for the year 1813. Ending 5th April 1814. To [Samuel Staneforth, Esq] of the [Township] of [Attercliff] [illegible] [Darnall]. Your assessment in my duplicate for the present year, delivered to me on the [12] day of [July] under the Acts relating to the Duties of Assessed Taxes amounts to the sum of [£33/19/10] the particulars of which are stated on the back hereof , and the Assessment may be seen at my house as under-mentioned. If you have any cause to appeal against the same you must give notice in writing 28 days after the said [12] day of [July] to the Surveyor or Inspector for this district orf to one of the assessors of the*. The day of appeal is fixed for the [23] day of [August]. Signed: [Wm Marriott] Collector, residing at "Attercliff'".

title: [Tax bill for Samuel Staneforth Esqr of Attercliff [illegible] Darnall, dated July 12, 1814]
note: Verso of tax bill reads: "Wm. Marriott. Attercliff". Taxes for windows, inhabited house duty, horses (own use, to let to hire, race horses), horses & mules, and dogs totalling £33/19/10. Receipt of payment not recorded.

title: [Tax bill for Samuel Staneforth Esqr of Attercliff [illegible] Darnall, dated July 12, 1814]
note: Other taxable items listed on the bill are: male servants or male performs herein described, 2W. car, 4W carr, allowance for children.

title: [Tax bill for Samuel Staneforth Esqr of Attercliff [illegible] Darnall, dated July 12, 1814]
note: "1st part for 1813. Ending April 5th, 1814".

title: [Tax bill for Samuel Staneforth Esqr of Attercliff [illegible] Darnall, dated July 12, 1814]
note: "N.B. These duties are payable by instalments quarterly, viz. the 20th of June, 20th of September, 20th of December, and 20th of March, or within 10 days after; and the full amount for the first half year, if not sooner paid as aforesaid, will be collected or levied on your goods and chatels on the 10t of October, and the full amount for the second half year, if not pad as aforesaid, will be collected or levied in line manner on the 5th of April, or within twenty-one days after those respective periods; in default of distress or payment you will be subject to process for the recovery thereof from the Court of Exchequer with cost; and if you remove from this parish without discharging the taxes due, or leaving sufficient goods whereon distress may be made, you will be liable to a penalty of twenty pounds".

title: [Tax bill for C. Johnstone, Paddington, Middlesex, October 4th, 1856]
note: Completed in pen and ink.

title: [Tax bill for C. Johnstone, Paddington, Middlesex, October 4th, 1856]
note: Tax bill for C. Johnstone, Esq of Paddington, Middlesex totalling £10/9/11. Taxes to be paid include £4/10/0 for house tax, £1/11/6 for 3 male servants, £1/15/0 for 1 carriage with four wheels, £1/1/1 for 2 horses for riding or drawing carriage, £0/6/0 for 1 dog and £1/6/5 for 6 armorial bearings. Other taxable items include carriages with two wheels, hair powder, horse dealer's duty and land tax. Printed on blue paper. "Taxes" written on back.

title: [Tax bill for C. Johnstone, Paddington, Middlesex, October 4th, 1856]
note: "Land and assessed taxes, 1856-7-- First Moiety, County of Middlesex. Parish or place Paddington. No. [2418]. Received of Mr. C.. Johnstone, Esq. the [4] day [October] 185[6], the sum of [ten] pounds [nine] shillings and [eleven] pence, for two quarters' taxes due 20th September, 1856, the particulars of which are stated in the margin. [Geo. Reading] Collector".

title: [Tax bill for C. Johnstone, Paddington, Middlesex, October 4th, 1856]
note: "Note.-Persons removing the parish or place, without first paying the duties, render themselves liable to a penalty of £20".

title: [Fire insurance policy for Mr. Robert Gibbs, March 1, 1808, from British Fire Office]
note: "British Fire Office. Strand and Cornhill, March 1, 1808. [Sir], The next annual payment on your policy, no. [2617] becoming due at Lady-Day next, I beg to remind you, that if the same is not paid within fifteen days therefrom, you cannot claim any benefits from the insurance in case of accident. Please bring this letter or the number of your policy when you come to pay the insurance, and if any alteration in the place or property of the insurance, the policy itself. I am, [Sir], your most obedient servant, Robert Skelton, Sec.

note: "Phœnix Fire Office. 19 Lombard St. and 57, Charing Cross, London. This policy of insurance witnesseth, that [Mr. Thomas Mason, of the Elmes. Longdon near Preston, Lancashire, Bank Manager] hereinafter call the Insured, having paid to the Phœnix Fire Office of London hereinafter called the Company, the sum of [four shillings and eight pence] for insuring against Loss or damage by fire or lighting, as hereinafter mention, the property hereinafter descripting in the several sums following, namely: on household goods, linen, printed books, wearing apparel, plate, watches, clocks, trinkets, wines, liquors, and mathematical and musical instruments [and] on china, glass, and looking=glasses [and] on pictures and prints (no one picture or print, case of loss to be valued at more than £[10]. In [his] private dwelling house, situate as above, Brick=built. [and stated].

title: [Fire insurance policy for Mr. Thomas Mason,  May 9th, 1891 from the Phœnix Fire Office]
note: [Memo: The person named Thomas Mason is now dead & it has been declared that the Interes law this policy is now vested in his widow Mrs. Jane Mason now residing at a house brick built of late. Known by the name Dryden Schawler at London aforesaid hereaftermore has declared that the property named herein is now [illegible] by this policy. Entered in the office books 20 Sept 1898. Dodgson Fire Agents Preston].

title: [Fire insurance policy for Mr. Thomas Mason,  May 9th, 1891 from the Phœnix Fire Office]
note: "The Company hereby agrees with the Insured, (but subject to the conditions at the back hereof, which are to be taken as part of this Policy), that if the property above described, or an part thereof, shall be destroyed by fire or lightning, at an time between the [30th April 1891] and the 2th June, 189[2], both inclusive, or at any time afterwards, so loss as the insured or [his] representatives, being successors in interest, shall pay to the company, and it shall accept the sum required for the renewal of this policy, such loss or damage, to an amount not exceeding in respect of the several matters above specified the sum set opposite thereto respectively, and not exceeding in the sum of [two hundred pounds]. In witnesss whereof, one of the Directors of the said Company has hereunto set his hand, the [9th] day of [May 189[1]. Total premium: £0/4/8 to Midsummer, 189[2]. Annual premium: £0/4/8 payable 23th June. [Edwin B. Portman]. Examined, [illegible]

title: [Advertisement for patent doors, windows, & shutters for the prevention of burglary]

We remain your mos obedt. servts, [Harris & Kitchen]"
