title: Crystal Palace season ticket, 1855.
note: Season ticket for admission to Crystal Palace, 1855 ("available till 30 April 1856"). No. 21921, signed by Charles Carrington (the ticket holder). All text is engraved, with printing on both sides, the rules of use on the reverse. In contemporary calf wallet, with blue silk lining.

title: Crystal Palace season ticket, 1855.
note: "This ticket is available till April 1856. It admits the proprietor to the palace and park whenever they are open to the public, but not at other times. The proprietor must sign his name on the face of the ticket before presenting it and also in a book at the door whenever required so to do. The ticket must be shewn whenever he enters the palace and when asked for by the savants of the Crystal Palace Company. If presented by another than the person who signed it it will be forfeited. Ticket lost cannot be replaced. The bearer of this ticket is bound to observe all the rules made from time to time by the directors for the regulation of visitors."--Verso.

title: [Printed invoice and promotional handbill of Hafod Arms Hotel].
note: The hotel was originally a small hunting lodge built in 1787 by Thomas Johnes, the then squire of The Hafod Mansion Estate, and it was enlarged and converted into a Swiss style chateau in 1839 by the third Duke of Newcastle, and Sir Henry Houghton. It attracted numerous visitors and inspired the Wordsworth poem "To the torrent at Devil's Bridge".

title: [Printed invoice and promotional handbill of Hafod Arms Hotel].
note: The invoice features an engraved illustration of Devil's Bridge.

title: [Printed invoice and promotional handbill of Hafod Arms Hotel].
note: "This Hotel is erected amidst the wildest and most magnificent scenery, on a precipice contiguous to the Devil's Bridge, commanding a view of the Grand Cataract of the Rhydol, and within hearing of the tumultous Fall of the Mynach. Distance from the Hafod 5 miles ; from the Ruins of Strataflorida Abbey 9 ; from Aberystwith 12 ; from London 199 miles."

title: [Printed invoice and promotional handbill of Hafod Arms Hotel].
note: "Height of the Cataracts. From the bridge to the water, 114 feet ; first fall, 18 feet ; second 60 ; third 20, Grand Cataract 110 feet ; total from the bridge to the bed of the river, 322 feet."

title: Pontifical (fragment).
note: Written area 138 x 82 mm. Single column of 21 lines. Foliated "viii" in red in the upper right-hand corner.

title: Pontifical (fragment).
note: Written in a humanist script influenced by roman typeface. In his commentary on the Lessing J. Rosenwald Collection's Horae Beatae Mariae ad usum Romanum (Octavo Editions, 1999), Christopher de Hamel notes that this script is associated on “very little evidence” with Geoffroy Tory (c.1480-c.1533), printer to King Francis I of France. The script occurs in manuscripts from the centers of court patronage in northern France.

title: Pontifical (fragment).
note: Decorated with seven two-line initials, on alternating blue and gold grounds. The initials on blue grounds are gold and the blue grounds are highlighted with white penwork. Three of the initials on gold grounds are blue and one is white. Gold grounds are decorated either with white flourishes or with foliage and berries. There are also six one-line paraphs and one one-line initial, in alternating gold and white. The gold initials are on blue grounds, highlighted in white penwork, and the white initials are on gold grounds decorated with black dots and white pearls. Headings are rubricated. The line-fillers alternate between gold branches and gold boxes filled with buds and white flourishes. The leaf has gilding on the fore- and top-edges.

title: Pontifical (fragment).
note: This leaf may be from the same manuscript as the leaves from an untraced Pontifical sold by King Alfred's Notebook in 2014 as items 1B and 49 in the catalogue Enchiridion 19: Medieval Fragments for University Teaching & Research. According to Scott Gwara, those leaves once belonged to Otto F. Ege (1888-1951), the manuscript and book collector famous for cutting leaves out of his manuscripts to sell them individually.

title: Pontifical (fragment).
note: The same sequence of prayer appears in a series of instructions for prayers before mass at ff.32v-33v in the Pontifical of Yves de Mayeuc (Rennes, Bibliothèque de Rennes Métropole MS 1278), which is written in a very similar hand. It also appears in two Parisian printed missals considered in Robert Lippe, Missale Romanum Mediolani, 1474: a collation with other editions printed before 1570 (London: Henry Bradshaw Society, 1899-1907) vol. II, 378-9, one printed in 1530 by Fr. Regnault, the other in 1540 by vidua Th. Kerver.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Incipit of Aṭbāq al-dhahab: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Allāhumma innā naḥmaduka ʻalá mā asbalta min shaʼābīb karamik wa-sabbalta min jalābīb niʻamik wa-nashkuruka ʻalá mā afadta min kalimātika al-tāmmah wa-afdta min hibātika al-ʻāmmah wa-afḍta min ladhādhāt maʻrifatika wa-nafaḍta min radhādhāt ʻārifatika wa-nuthnī ʻalayka bi-mā asalta min ḍaḥḍāḥ al-ʻulūm wa-ghasalta ʻannā min awḍāḥ al-luʼm wa-kaḥaltanā bi-burūd yaqīnika wa-naḥaltanā min jūd yamīnika shukran yamlaʼu khāṣirat al-majhūd wa-ḥamdan yalīqu bi-al-ḥāmid dūna al-maḥmūd ..."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Secundo folio of Aṭbāq al-dhahab: al-shahawāt, wa-arshidnā fī ghayāhib al-shubuhāt.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Incipit of Aṭwāq al-dhahab fī al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-khuṭab: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Allāhumma innī aḥmaduka ʻalá mā anzalta ilayya min niʻmatik wa-mā azalta ʻannī min niqmatik ʻalá annī lam akun ahlan lil-ūlá wa-kuntu bi-al-thāniyah awlá lawlā faḍlun minka sābiq ḥamd al-ḥāmid warāʼahu yuqṭaf wa-in aʻnaqa fa-ka-annahu maṣfūd yursaf ..."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Secundo folio of Aṭwāq al-dhahab fī al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-khuṭab: al-fiʼah allatī bi-iḥsānik al-mutaẓāhir.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: In fair naskh/ruqʻah script; headings and markings in red; catchwords.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folio 1a: Kitāb Aṭbāq al-dhahab lil-ʻAllāmah al-muḥaqqiq Muḥammad Shufurwah raḥimahu Allāh. Aṭwāq al-dhahab lil-ʻAllāmh al-Zamakhsharī raḥimahu Allāh.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folio 1a an ownership note: "Min minaḥ al-fayyāḍ al-muṭlaq ladá ʻabdihi al-mudhnib Aḥmad ibn Ḥusayn al-Kīwānī al-Shāmī bi-Qusṭanṭīnīyah al-maḥmīyah sanat 1147 [1734/1735]." (Probably the melancholic and aloof poet from Damascus, Syria, d. 1173 H/1759 or 1760. Cf. Ziriklī, al-Aʻlām, 1:118)

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folio 77a: "Muʼallif hādhā al-kitāb Shams al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Iṣfahānī al-maʻrūf bi-Shufrūh taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-anālahu buḥbūḥat jannatih bi-Muḥammad wa-ʻitratih wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-yatlūhu al-Aṭwāq lil-Zamakhsharī raḥmat Allāh ʻalayh."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folios 77a-77b: "ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh Muḥammad ibn Hibat Allāh ibn Ḥamzah al-maʻrūf bi-Shawrwah bi-al-Shīn al-muʻjamah wa-al-wāw wa-al-rāʼ al-sākinah baʻdahā wāw wa-hāʼ, Sharaf al-Dīn ibn Nūr al-Dīn ibn Wajīh al-Dīn al-Iṣbahānī, kāna jadduhu qāḍī Iṣbahān, wa-kāna wāliduhu Nūr al-Dīn wāʻiẓan ḥāfiẓan. Waṣala Shawrwah ilá Dimashq akhira ayyām Nūr al-Dīn al-Shahīd wa-ʻaqada majlis waʻẓ ḥaḍrata Nūr al-Dīn wa-aslama ʻalá yadihi awwala yawm ṣaghīr Naṣrānī fa-qāla badīhan: 'Naṣabnā fikhākhan fa-iṣṭadnā farkhan ..."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folios 78a-78b verses by Ibn al-Fāriḍ.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folios 79a-80a biographical information about Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī.

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: On folio 81a: "Hādhā Kitāb Aṭwāq al-dhahab."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Colophon of Aṭbāq al-dhahab: "... Wa-al-ḥamud lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭāhirīn wa-aṣḥābihi al-fāḍilīn wa-anṣārihi al-Muhājirīn, wa-sallam taslīman. Najazat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah fī yawm al-Sabt al-ʻishrīn min Ramaḍān al-muʻaẓẓam li-sanat arbaʻah wa-khamsīn wa-sabʻimiʼah Hijrīyah."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Translation of the colophon of Aṭbāq al-dhahab: "Praise be to God Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his virtuous family, his honorable companions and his supporters, the Muhājirīn, and grant them abundant peace. This blessed copy was completed on Saturday, the 20th of honorable Ramaḍān, 754 of the Hijrah [19 October, 1353]."

title: 880-03 Aṭbāq al-dhahab / Sharaf al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Muʼmin ibn Hibat Allāh al-Maghribī al-Iṣfahānī.
note: Colophon of Aṭwāq al-dhahab fī al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-khuṭab: No colophon. Text ends with "al-Maqālah al-miʼah" (Sermon 100), as follows: "Lam tarḍa li-sharābika illā an yurawwaq wa-an yuṣaffá wa-yuṣaffaqa, wa-illā ramayta bi-mujājatihi, wa-rubbamā anḥayta ʻalá zujājatihi, fa-kayfa raḍīta li-dīnaka bi-al-qadhá, wa-al-muʼminu lā yarḍá li-dīnihi bi-dhā? Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb."

title: La passe solitaire.
note: Decoration: 13 large full-color miniatures in architectural frames illustrating various events in the allegorical pilgrimage of the author's soul, guided by Dame Inspiration. The opening miniature is full-page and depicts the author asleep beneath a tree hung with her coat of arms. Other subjects include: the soul, accompanied by Dame Inspiration, begins her pilgrimage to the Fontaine de Penitence f.9; Inspiration explains to the soul what needs to be done in order to reach the Fontaine de Penitence f.11, the soul, carried on the back of Inspiration, flies to the Château de Contention diabolique f.17, Inspiration and the soul meet Raison f.20; the soul enters the Chemin de Crainte de Dieu f.35; souls are cleansed in the Fontaine de Penitence f.47; the soul sets off on her journey to the Terre de Promission f.50v; the company journey to the coast where they find boats awaiting them f.53; the company embark f.58; the company sets off on the Navire de Penitence f.61; the company is attacked by seven other boats f.63; the company is swept up by the Vent de Hypocrisie f.69v.

title: L'aiguillon d'amour divine.
note: Decoration: rubricated. Five half-page miniatures and one arch-topped miniature, accompanied by full-page borders. The subjects of the miniatures are as follows: f.3 A lady kneeling before St. Jerome, seated, with the lion at his feet. f.10 The same lady presented to the Annunciate Virgin by the Archangel Gabriel, whose scroll greeting the Virgin curls up behind the lady's head as if she too uttered the words. f.19 Coronation of the Virgin with hovering angels on either side with scrolls oriented for them to read 'Hec est regina virginum' and 'Ave maris stella'. f.30v Christ standing in a lush landscape teaching the kneeling apostles and disciples the Lord's Prayer, the words on his scroll coming from Matthew 6:9. f.48 The lady, with her patron St. Jerome, kneeling and offering her soul, in the form of a naked child, up to God above, illustrating the opening words of Psalm 24 (Vulgate) on her scroll; to the right a young man kneeling with his patron saint, a deacon martyr, and the second verse of the psalm continuing on his scroll. f.101 Crucifixion flanked by the lady with the Virgin and the young man with St. John the Evangelist.

title: Gospel of Mark.
note: Script: Copied by a single scribe in Praegothica with Southern features in two sizes. Some glosses are added by other hands.

title: Gospel of Mark.
note: Decoration: Limited decoration. Paragraph marks by the scribe in the ink of the text. A few 1-line versals in red. A few larger primitive flourished initials, red or blue, with penwork in the opposite colour. The text of art. 1 begins with a 4-line littera duplex “M” in red and blue colour. Art. 2 opens with a 10-line primitive dentelle initial “I” in gold on a blue and red background, which is heightened with white penwork design. The initial is shown resting on the back of a small bent male figure, coloured red and gold.

title: Gospel of Mark.
note: Binding: Romanesque, with undecorated white (deerskin?) leather over rounded wooden boards, sewn on three leather thongs (spine repaired). There was originally one leather strap fixed with two nails to the front board and closing over a pin in the center of the rear board. Later this strap was replaced by two straps similarly fixed with iron nails to the front board. This arrangement appears to have been changed at the end of the Middle Ages, when a title was inscribed on the front cover and an iron chain was attached at the bottom of the front board by means of an iron staple. The endleaves are two parchment bifolios from an antiphonary (Italy, 11th century), containing text and music for the offices of Ash Wednesday and the first weeks of Lent. The notation is diastematic. Rubrics and initials are missing.

title: Summa de casibus conscientiae.
note: Script: Copied by Jodocus Sparlützel in a single hand in Gothica Hybrida Libraria. The scribe is elsewhere given the name Jodocus Sparlützel (Swicker) de Wil.

title: Summa de casibus conscientiae.
note: Decoration: Red stroking of the majuscules and red underlining. Red plain initials, normally 1-2 lines; the initial of the first lemma beginning with a given letter of the alphabet is larger (up to 7 lines) and may be a flourished initial with penwork in the same red colour. Many initials are given strange and fancy forms. Erroneous initials are found on ff. 109r, 246v, 248v. An initial “U” is missing on f. 246r, and in art. 4, no initials “T”, “X”, “Y” and “Z” were provided by the scribe.

title: Summa de casibus conscientiae.
note: Binding: Original binding, with a repaired spine, composed of (very damaged) undecorated brown leather over wooden boards, and sewn on three double cords(?), with plaited headbands. Five brass bosses are on each cover. Two clasps are attached to the rear board and rectangular engraved catches are on the front board. The inscription, in Northern Gothica Textualis Formata, is not deciphered.

title: Invoices from the Lemon-Tree Tavern and Hotel : Aberdeen, to various, 1802 June 11, 1806 April 2, and 1811 April 19.
note: Each with ms. note on verso. 1806 example printed on green paper.

title: Breviary: Sanctorale and Common of the Saints.
note: Script: Written in Gothica Semihybrida Libraria. The original arts. 1, 2, and 5 are written in one hand. Art. 6 is in a different hand. The other texts are written by various hands in small script.

title: Breviary: Sanctorale and Common of the Saints.
note: Decoration: In the original parts, there are countless red rubrics, 1-line versals, red underlinings, red stroking of majuscules and red running headlines. Some articles open with a larger red plain initial. In art. 3 there is red underlining and red stroking of majuscules. Art. 4 is undecorated. In artt. 7-9 there is red stroking of majuscules and extensive parts of the text are in red underline.

title: Breviary: Sanctorale and Common of the Saints.
note: Binding: Original quarter binding sewn on three double cords: white pigskin over wooden boards, now covered by fragments of a 14th century liturgical music manuscript on parchment, with text in Northern Gothica Textualis Formata and “Hufnagel” notation on 4-line black staves. Handwritten title on spine (18th century). Paper(?) flyleaves.

title: Apocryphal Gospel Books and Miracles of the Virgin.
note: Script: Copied by two scribes. Hand 1, the notary Franciscus Salvator (Francesco Salvatore) from Ventimiglia, copied artt. 1-4 in Gothica Semihybrida Libraria (Mercantesca). Hand 2 copied artt. 5-6 in Gothica Hybrida Libraria/Currens (Mercantesca).

title: Apocryphal Gospel Books and Miracles of the Virgin.
note: Decoration: Long red headings up to f. 29r (artt. 1-2). In artt. 3-4, space for headings was provided, but they were not executed. Space was reserved for 2-line initials, but these were not executed. title: Tax bill for William Hanham, Cranleigh, Surrey,  August 27th, 1843.
note: "Assessed taxes to William Hanham Esq. of the Parish of Cranley. Your first assessment in my duplicate for the present year ending 5th April, 1843, of duties not compounded for, delivered to me on the 27 day of August under the acts relating to the duties of assessed taxes, amounts to the sum of 53/7/3 the particulars of which are stated on the back hereof, and the assessment may be seen at my house as undermentioned. If you have any cause to appeal against the same, you must give notice in writing, within twenty-eight days after the above mentioned day to the surveyor of taxes, or to one of the assessors of this place,. Signed: Charles Herington Collector. Residing at Cranley."

title: Collection of eight ham radio QSL calling cards. 1936-1939.

title: Collection of eight ham radio QSL calling cards. 1936-1939.
note: A QSL is generated when a first-time contact between two amateur radio operators (hams) or stations occurs. It is an acknowledgement of the listening and is usually the size of a postcard. Each card includes the call sign of its sender along with date and time of the call, equipment used to make the call, and any words or illustrations that describe the ham and his/her home. QSL means, "Do you confirm receipt of my transmission?" or "I confirm receipt of your transmission."

note: Decoration: the preface on fol. 2r begins with a 10-line decorated initial "D" in red interlace on a green geometric ground with a blue ground for the central portion of the vine stem; the text of Genesis begins with a half-page decorated initial "I" in the same style; 1-line initials in the prefatory material are occasionally red; line fillers are in red; rubrics are written in red in the same script as the text; accents added by a later hand; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text.

title: Bible, Sirach (fragment).
note: Script: written in a late Caroline minuscule.

title: Bible, Sirach (fragment).

title: Gradual (fragment).

title: Gradual (fragment).

title: Breviary (fragment).

title: Breviary (fragment).

title: Antiphonary (fragment).

title: Liturgical book (fragment).
note: According to scholar Neil Harris, identifiable as the text of a Cisterican or Benedictine Breviary, 4th Sunday after Pentecost. On the front cover the text reads: "hora cene dicere inuitat <,,,> et uenirent quia omnia para <...> a sint alleluia. Benedictus deus" and on the back "Exi cito in plateas & uico <...> uitatis et pauperes ac deb <,,,> es cecos et claudos compelle". For the date, also given that it was still in Italy in quite modern times, can be safely assigned to northern or central Italy in the fifteenth century or very early sixteenth. Though the parchment is old, the binding itself is modern, i.e. early 20th century (just a bit of a falsification, probably done by Martini). The endpapers are on mechanical paper and the edges are not very scuffed. Autograph "J. Martini" of Giuseppe Martini on front paste-down. Manuscript notes (of Martini?) on free front endpaper.

title: Liturgical texts and doxologies.
note: Pages are not in order. Some repairs to damaged pages. Vol. 1 = Contains titles: "Gospel of Luke" and "Psalm 131." Contains passages from Luke, Acts, John, as well as fragments of a crowning liturgical text. Some exposition on water, blood, and Spirit. Multiple rubrications appear to be intentionally blotted out. Vol. 2 = Emphasis on Anthony, Elijah, Mary, Christ, David, and Solomon. Some pages stuck together. On one page (12v), St. Cyril's name is stricken and replaced by Teoskoros (Dioscorus of Alexandria?).

Note on the inside of the front cover: “This volume contains a set of Coptic = Arabic Grammars. I obtained it from the Rev. Jn. Lieder at Cairo - 16th April 1858.” Contains a stamp from the Allan Library (~1891). Bookplate and de-accession stamp from the London Library, St. James' Square, on the front cover. In use in the London Library at least during the 1920's.

title: Dictionary.
note: From the collection of Rev. Johann Rudolph Theophilus Lieder (1797-1865). His collection of antiquities was purchased by William Tyssen-Amherst, First Baron Amherst of Hackney, for £200 in 1868. Note on the inside of the front cover: “This is a Coptic = Arabic Dictionary or [Iyllim?] (Scales) as I think Jn. Lieder said a Dictionary of this kind is called. It is a MS Copy of one which has been recently found for one of the Coptic Convents in Egypt. I procured it from the Rev. Jn. Lieder at Cairo -16th April 1858.” Contains a stamp from the Allan Library, a Methodist foreign-language book and manuscript library (~1891). Bookplate and de-accession stamp from the London Library, St. James' Square, on the front cover. In use in the London Library at least during the 1920's.

title: Indenture placing John Dikes into the service of John Morris, joiner.
note: "This indenture witnesseth that [John Dikes], one of the poor [boys] of the charity-school [commonly called the Blue Coat School in the Parish of St. Margaret, Westminster, in the county of Middlesex] doth put h[im]self apprentice to [John Morris of the Parish of St. John the Evangelist, joiner] to learn h[is] art, and with h[im] after the manner of an apprentice to serve from the day of the date hereof, unto the full end and term of [seven] years ... And the said M[aster], (in consideration of the sum of [five] pounds paid to [him] ... ) ... shall teach and instruct, or cause to be taught and instructed, finding unto his said apprentice, meat drink apparel, lodging, washing, and all other necessaries ... In witness thereof, the parties abovenamed to these indentures interchangeably have put their hands and seals the [sixth] day of [October], Anno Dom. 17[40] ... [Memorandm. And it is further covenanted & agreed that the sd. Master shall find and provide for his sd. apprentice one complete suite of new cloths both of linnen and woolen at the expiration of the sd. term. John Morris."

title: Indenture placing John Dikes into the service of John Morris, joiner.

title: Indenture placing John Dikes into the service of John Morris, joiner.
note: At the head of the indenture is an engraved allegorical triptych. The center panel features a depiction of George III. At left, a young female student stands in front of "the Pillar of Faith" and bears a sign reading "And we as mothers of our Israel." At right, a young male student stands in front of "the Gate of Life" and bears a sign reading "In cause of Church & State may we Excell."

title: Discourses.
note: Script: Large uncial script.

title: Discourses.
note: White Monastery codex ZD, pp. 193-200. Black ink. Most text is well-preserved; some pages are faded. Two columns per page. Lack of decoration/rubrication. Small fragment contains ink, but no discernible letters. Leaf 1, r = Theological exposition concerning the cross and idolatry with a quotation from Ps 97:7. Leaf 1, v = Mentions heaven and the fires of Gehenna. Leaf 2, r = Mentions a mountain or monastery (ptoou), the sea, and potentially an entourage (komitaton). Leaf 2, v = Coptic page numeration: 198. Mentions a king, the Lord, and land, and sin. Also mentions “those who know the apostles say this: 'God [is] in Christ, who reconciles the world to him.' The interpretation of these things...those who hear me a few times in the midst of every crowd.” Leaf 3, v = Mentions a synagogue and a discourse ("I answered, saying to them: 'It is good...'"). Leaf 4, r = Discourse on "lift[ing] up our cross" and endless prayer. Mentions the kingdom of Christ. Leaf 4, v = Mentions the Lord, grace/gift, a procession out, and "the one who made them."

title: Canon.
note: Script: Large uncial script.

title: Canon.
note: Black ink. Two columns. Recto is well-preserved; verso is faded. Some minor lacunae. The text is from Codex XF of the White Monastery, including text from Shenoute's Canon 6. Recto focuses on the commandment of God, with a reference to the "gospel of God" and "brothers." Verso focuses on God's teaching and Satan.

title: Bible: Revelation
note: Decoration:

title: Bible: Revelation
note: Black, red, and green ink. Some binding repairs with reused Arabic texts. Final half of book suffers from water staining. Coptic numeration = pp. 12-130 + p. 153. ff. 1-5 = Liturgical text, including prayers and praises of bishops. Use of Abba NIM ("Father so-and-so") as a stock phrase that can be filled in by any episcopal leader. Mentions Jerusalem as the metropolis; mentions the Book of Life. Potential title = the chiliographon (thousand-writer?). ff. 6-103 = Revelation (titled: The Unveiling of What He Saw, namely, of John the Evangelist). Rubrication and decorative headpieces to mark off John's seven "letters" to the churches of Asia. Missing pages (via Coptic numeration) = 20, 60, 74-75, 77, 81, 90-100, 121-152. Corresponds to lacking Rev 1:8-11, 7:11-14, 10:1-7, 10-11:1, 11-13, 13:1-14:15, 19:12- 22:21. Some letter headings contain marginalia saying "Answer: ..." = Call-and-response? Coptic marginalia in pencil (f. 58). 104r = "He said this, which testifies to these things, namely, that they will occur and that they are coming soon. Come, Lord Jesus Christ, upon all the saints from age to age. Amen." MS concludes with seven pages (4 ff.) of Arabic text.

title: Bible: Revelation
note: Binding: Modern cloth binding (20th century).

title: Bible: Isaiah.
note: Script: Uncial script. Multiple scribal hands.

title: Bible: Isaiah.
note: Decoration: Rubrication.

title: Bible: Isaiah.
note: Black and red ink. Significant staining on leaves 2 and 3. Fiber backing used to support ff. Folio 1 preserves only one column per side; leaves 2-3 preserve two columns. Folio 1 contains a narrative about grapes, cutting, the Lord of Hosts, Judea (1r); strong drink, a cithara, a psaltery, and wine (1v). Folio 2 contains a narrative about eating and drinking, those whom God remembers, divine judgment (2r); and Isaiah 24:4-15 (2v). Folio 3 contains Isaiah 40:2-20.

title: Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica.
note: Script: Uncial script. Black and red ink.

title: Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica.
note: Decoration: Some decorative headpieces.

title: Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica.
note: Bound together with: Abu Ishaq ibn al-Assal, Scala Rimata. John of Samannud's Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica were originally written in the 13th century. All three texts preserved are Coptic grammatical works, presumably for continuation of the language, which was waning in popularity. According to internal Coptic numeration, first nine pages are missing. Numbered folios = 9-123. Contains chapter divisions (Cpt. = kephaleon). Some sections are alphabetically arranged. Many pages still bound in sections. Severe worming and heavy damage to some pages. Significant staining throughout. Some Arabic marginalia. Some letters excised.

title: Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica.
note: Binding: 17th century binding with stamped or pressed floral decoration. Some worming. Some Arabic script on the back flyleaf.

title: Early Christian narrative.
note: Script: Uncial script. Black and red ink.

title: Early Christian narrative.

title: Early Christian narrative.
note: Some rubrication and decoration. Some spots have letters of a different ink -- perhaps a palimpsest. Two columns. References to Theodorus (of Tabennese?). Coptic numeration suggests this is p. 15-16 of its MS. Substantial staining to half of folio. Recto references a presbyter, frank speech, John, Theodo[rus?], and an elder. Verso references [Theo]dorus.

title: Theological discourse.

title: Theological discourse.
note: Repairs to top of folio; majority of the folio preserved. Significant wax staining on verso. Two columns. Recto = Theological discourse concerning Jesus and the “Day of the Lord.” Also mentions the “poor brothers.” Verso = Theological discourse on women, their dangers to men, and adornment of the body.

title: Various Coptic fragments.

title: Various Coptic fragments.
note: Decoration: Rubrication.

title: Various Coptic fragments.
note: Black and red ink. Significant staining on some fragments. Frag. 1 = Only discernible word is "misfortune" (v). Frag. 2 = Recto contains the Coptic page numeration 15; verso is marked as page 16. r = "his exaltedness...and I was...a laughing thing...for in the...exaltedness...testimony...from...virgin..." v = "tread upon...woman...the king of...was able...woman...was able...up to...the one who..." Frag. 3 = Little extant text. Frag. 4 = Page numeration included: 128. Appears to be a palimpsest, with a nomen sacrum XC ("Christ") mostly faded on recto. r = "from...that...weep and..." v = "and you did not...you should not look at...for we..." Frag. 5 = Little extant text. Frag. 6 = Very stained. Small script. r = "when...when...them...him..." v = No discernible words. Frag. 7 = Text only on recto, but too faded to discern words. Frag. 8 = Recto contains fragment of a title page of a Bohairic liturgical text. r = "people..." v = "...Gabriel the angel proclaimed..." Frag. 9 = Fragment of a Bohairic liturgical text. References liturgical blessing.

Verso of front flyleaf contains annotation by Thomas Bayly that he has sold "this bible and one old magna charta...warranted to bee perfett," 1629 May 11. Back pastedown and endleaf manuscript waste from a sixteenth-century indenture concerning George Jackson, in English.

title: 880-02 Barīqah Maḥmūdīyah fī sharḥ Ṭarīqah Muḥammadīyah wa-sharīʻah Nabawīyah fī sīrah Aḥmadīyah. Al-Jild 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khādimī.
note: Colophon: "Intahá al-juzʼ al-awwal taḥrīran fī sanat thamān wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf thumma yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-thānī, awwaluhu: al-Ṣinf al-awwal fī munkarāt al-qalb, al-munkarāt al-ṣādirah min al-qalb wa-āfātuh ay al-balīyah al-mutarattibah ʻalayh. Wa-yalīhi al-juzʼ al-thālith, awwaluhu al-khāmis wa-al-thalāthūn min al-sittīn, al-Faẓāẓah wa-ghilẓat al-qalb wa-bihi yatimmu al-kitāb min Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah li-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-Birkawī wa-sharḥuhu li-Ustādhinā Muḥammad al-Khādimī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāhumā wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāhumā. Allāhumma infaʻnā bi-ʻulūmihimā bi-ḥurmat aslāfihimā wa-irfaʻ darajātinā fī aʻlá ʻillīyīn wa-iḥshirnā maʻa al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn. Āmīn. Wa-salām ʻalá al-mursalīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-anā al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr [...] ibn Ḥasan ibn [...] al-shahīr bi-Ḥaqdārʹzādah yassara Allāh lahum al-ḥusná wa-al-ziyādah. Āmīn. Bi-jāh al-Karīm al-Amīn ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

title: 880-02 Barīqah Maḥmūdīyah fī sharḥ Ṭarīqah Muḥammadīyah wa-sharīʻah Nabawīyah fī sīrah Aḥmadīyah. Al-Jild 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khādimī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "The copying of the first part has ended in the year 1208 [1793/1794]. It will be followed by the second part which begins with the first section on the abominations of the heart, that is the abominations that eminate from the heart and its ailments, i.e. the predicament that affects it. It will be follwed by the third part which begins with the thirty fifth of the sixty sections: Rudness and bluntness of the heart and by that the book of Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah [al-Muḥammadīyah] of our master Muḥammad al-Birkawī and the commentary on it by our teacher Muḥammad al-Khādimī is concluded. May God bless their resting place and make Paradise their abode. May God benefit us by their knowledge by the intercession of their predecessors. We beseech God to raise our ranks to the highest hights and to gather us with the prophets, the righteous, the martyrs and the virtuous. Amen. Peace be unto the messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. I, the despised and poor [...] ibn Ḥasan ibn [...] known as Ḥaqdārʹzādah, May God grant them the best end and more. Amen, by the intercession of the Benevolent and Faithful One, May God pray on him and give him peace.

title: 880-02 al-Kashf al-mujallī li-kalām al-Minhāj wa-al-shāriḥ al-Maḥallī : manuscript / ʻAlī al-Munīrī.
note: On folio 1a (in a different hand): "Minhāj al-jalīs fī al-fiqh li-Jalāl al-Maḥallī. Ḥamdan li-man rafaʻa al-ʻilm wa-jaʻalahu zīnat al-ḥayāh al-dunyā. Fa-yā ibn Ādam kun mutaʻalliman lā takun jāhilan wa-ijʻal samʻaka wa-baṣaraka ilá al-dīn al-qawīm wa-ijtanib al-maʻāṣī li-anna al-dunyā dunyā faná wa-man ʻalayhā fān fa-unẓur ilá alladhīn maḍū kānū qāʼilīn li-ahlihi ..."

title: 880-02 al-Kashf al-mujallī li-kalām al-Minhāj wa-al-shāriḥ al-Maḥallī : manuscript / ʻAlī al-Munīrī.
note: Ends with: "... qāla Ibn al-ʻImād wa-hādhā lā yunāfī ittifāq al-ʻulamāʼ ʻalá anna min aḥkām al-īmān al-ʻazm ʻalá fiʻl al-wājibāt fī al-mustaqbal li-anna maḥalla [then, in a different hand] li-anna maḥalla maḥalla ʻumūm al-ʻilm wa-al-fiqh wa-jāmiʻ maʻānīh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Maḥallī raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb al-Minhāj al-jalīs fī al-fiqh wa-jaʻaltuhu kāmil al-maʻānī wa-kāna intihāʼ [al-intihāʼ] fī sanat 1148, alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-arbaʻūn Hijrīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh dāyim al-salām."

note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir yā karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fataḥa aqfāl khazāyin qulūb ahl al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻirfān wa-khaṣṣahum bi-fahm mushkilāt kitābihi fa-ʻabbarū ʻanhā bi-awḍaḥ ʻibārah wa-aṣaḥḥ dalīl wa-burhān wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mabʻūth bi-afḍal al-lughāt min ashraf al-ʻUrbān wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ulī al-riwāyah wa-al-dirāyah wa-al-itqān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ḥaqīr al-muqaṣṣir faqīr al-muṣawwir Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī jammalahu Allāh bi-ishrāq al-sirr al-shuhūdī ..."

title: 880-02 al-Jawāhir al-ʻiẓām fī waqf Ḥamzah wa-Hishām : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Wa-al-maṭlūb mimman iṭṭalaʻa ʻalá hādhā al-taʼlīf an yanẓura fīhi bi-ʻayn al-riḍá wa-al-inṣāf lā bi-ʻayn al-sukhṭ wa-al-ijḥāf wa-in wajada fīhi khaṭaʼ aṣlaḥahu aw ʻayban satarahu wa-an yadraʼa bi-al-ḥasanah al-sayiʼah fa-qad qalla muʼallif an yaslama min al-hafawāt aw yanjwa muṣannif min al-ʻatharāt li-anna al-insān yaḥullu bi-hi al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-nisyān khuṣūṣan fī hādhā al-zamān alladhī kathurat fīhi al-shawāghil wa-al-humūm wa-ʻaẓumat fīhi al-qawāṭiʻ wa-al-ghumūm, nasʼalu Allāh an yunajjīnā min āfātih wa-an yaqīnā min tabiʻātih wa-an yumītanā ʻalá ḥifẓ Kitābih wa-an yuwaffiqanā li-ḍabṭihi wa-ṣawābih wa-an yamanna ʻalaynā wa-ikhwāninā bi-al-mawt ʻalá al-Islām wa-an yulḥiqanā bi-mashāyikhinā al-bararah al-kirām wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻihi yawm al-Ithnayn khāmis wa-ʻishrīn Shawwāl sanat thamāniyah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah 1168."

title: 880-02 al-Jawāhir al-ʻiẓām fī waqf Ḥamzah wa-Hishām : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God on finishing [the book]. It is requested that those who look into this composition to judge it with compassion and justice not with discontent and prejudice and if they see in it any mistake to correct it, or a blemish to cover it and to hide the bad with the good because no author is immune from making mistakes or writer from shortcomings because human beings are prone to mistakes and forgetfulness specially in this time in which concerns and worries have increased and calamities and sorrows are enormous. We ask God to deliver us from its disasters and to protect us from its implications and that we die protecting His Book and to grnat us to be able to keep it safe and sound and that He may make us and our brethren die as Muslims that we may follow in the path of our rightious and honorable masters. There is no power nor might except in God the most high and the most exalted. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the seal of the prophets and messengers and on his family and all his companions. Amen. The composition of this book was completed on Monday the twenty fifth of Shawwal, the year 1168 of the Hijrah [4 August, 1755]."

title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Nūbī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt fa-asʼalu Allāh Rabb al-Araḍīn wa-al-samāwāt an yanfaʻa bi-hi ka-mā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi innahu samīʻ qarīb mujīb al-daʻawāt. Qāla muʼallifuhu, ghafar Allāh la-hu: Wa-kāna dhālika ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi aḥqar al-makhlūqāt Aḥmad al-Nūbī, ghafara Allāh la-hu mā iqtarafahu min al-dhunūb wa-al-zallāt fī awākhir shahr Rajab al-fard min shuhūr sanat arbaʻīn wa-alf. Khatama Allāh aʻmālanā wa-aʻmāl al-muʼminīn bi-al-ṣāliḥāt. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Nūbī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God, May He be exalted, facilitated of "Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt." I beseech God, the Lord of heaven and earth that we benefit from it as we benefited from its origin; He listens and readily answers the invocations. Its author, May God forgive him, said: The book was written by its compiler, the most despised of creatures, Aḥmad al-Nūbī, May God forgive him what he commited of sins and shortcomings, at the end of the month of Rajab al-Fard of the year 1040, May God conclude our deeds and the deeds of the believers with righteousness. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa al-Raʼūf ʻabduhu Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻarī ṭarīqatan al-Saʻdīnī baldatan qad ikhtaṣartu jumlat Aḥādīth min kalām al-Muṣṭafá ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam tabarrukan bi-hi wa-in kuntu lastu min ahl hādhā al-maqām wa-lākin qad yukramu al-ṭufaylī fī maḥall al-kirām wa-ʻazawtu kull Ḥadīth li-rāwīhi wa-kull qawl li-qāʼilihi wa-nabbahtu ʻalá al-Ḥadīth al-ṣaḥīḥ wa-al-marfūʻ wa-al-mawqūf ..."

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.

note: In good and clear naskh script, in black ink on white paper with keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb ka-mā akhbara bi-dhālika al-ṣādiq al-maṣdūq ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-ʻalá ālihi al-aʻlām. M.M.M. taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Saʻdīnī baldatan al-Ashʻārī ṭarīqatan taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn".

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note: On folio 497b an endowment statement: "Waqafa wa-ḥabasa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr al-muqirr bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Yāsīn Makhlūf ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-jaʻala al-naẓar fīhi li-awlādihi baʻda wafātihi lā yubāʻu wa-lā yūhabu wa-lā yurhanu fa-man baddalahu baʻda mā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāh samīʻ ʻalīm. Kātibuhu al-faqīr Ḥusayn Saʻfān shākiran lillāh al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻlá kull ḥāll. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note: Colophon (folio 496b-folio 497a): "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi faqīr ʻafw rabbihi Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Saʻdīnī baldatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻārī ṭarīqatan. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-karīm bi-jāh Muḥammad ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam an yajʻalanā wa-mashāyikhinā wa-muḥibbīnā wa-kātib hādhih al-nuskhah maʻa alladhīna anʻama Allāh ʻlayhim min al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn wa-ḥasuna ulāʼika rafīqan wa-an yasturanā bi-sitrihi al-jamīl wa-an yuyassira lanā umūranā maʻa al-rāḥah li-qulūbinā wa-abdāninā fa-innahu mujīb al-duʻāʼ wa-lā yaruddu man qaṣadahu wa-iʻtamada ʻlayhi wa-fawwaḍa amarahu ilayhi. Wa-qad tawassalnā fī qabūl duʻāʼinā bi-jāh Rasūl Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam li-qawlihi ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Tawassalū bi-jāhī fa-inna jāhī ʻinda Allāh ʻaẓīm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Jumʻah ʻishrīn shahr Rabīʻ Awwal sanat 1293 (GhRJṢ) alf wa-miʼatayn thalāthah wa-tisʻīn baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-azká al-taḥīyah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note: Translation of the colophon (folio 496b-folio 497a): "This book is concluded by the praise of God the Benevolent King at the hand of its compiler Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Saʻdīnī (by town), al-Shāfiʻi (by school), al-Ashʻarī (by Ṣufī order). We beseech God by the exalted status of Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace, to gather us, our masters, our loved ones and the author of this copy with those whom God favored of the prophets, the rightious, the martyrs and the virtuous (What good companions those are!) and to protect us with his pleasant cover and to facilitate our matters with rest to our hearts and bodies because He answers invocation and does not turn back he who seeks Him, depends on Him and consigns himself to Him. We beseech God to accept our invokation by the status of the Messenger of God, May God pray on him and grant him peace beause he said: Beseech God in my status because my status is exalted with God. The writing of this book was concluded on Friday the twentieth of the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, the year 1293 (GhRJṢ [in alphabetical rconning]) of the Prophetic Hijrah, the best of prayer and peace and the most fragrant greetings be upon its originator. May God pray on our master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is concluded.

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note: Incipit: "Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī. Inna al-Qiddīs Afrām kāna min jins al-Suryān ayḍan min madīnat Nuṣaybīn wa-ummuhu min madīnat Umīd wa-abūhu kāna ḥabran fī Nuṣaybīn yakhdumu ṣanam ismuhu Īnīl dhāka alladhī hadamahu al-Malik al-ẓāfir Badbiyānūn fī ayyām al-Malik Qusṭanṭīn al-ẓāfir al-muʼmin al-ḥaqīqī ..."

note: 15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 13 lines per page.

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note: Binding: Unbound; 1 quire (49 numbered pages).

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note: In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink on aging white paper.

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note: Colophon: "Qad tammat qiṣṣat ḥayāt al-Qiddīs al-ʻaẓīm wa-al-ṭūbāwī Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī wa-al-muʻallim al-Ilāhī bi-qalam mutarjimihā min al-lughah al-Suryānīyah ilá al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah Buṭrus Rizq al-ʻAndārī aḥad talāmidhat Madrasat Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn wa-kāna dhālika fī al-dayr al-madhkūr fa-yarjū ghaḍḍ al-naẓar min kull labīb wa-adīb ʻammā faraṭa minhu al-khaṭaʼ siwá kāna min al-imlāʼ am min tarkīb al-jumal fa-subḥān man huwa maʻṣūm faqaṭ. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kutayyib fī 17 K 2 [Kānūn al-Thānī] sanat 1895 Masīḥīyah. Fa-Allāh yuʻṭīnā an naʻīsha ka-hādhā al-Qiddīs al-ʻaẓīm wa-natamaththal wa-naqtadī bi-ḥayātihi al-mamlūwah qadāsah. Fa-hādhā mā aṭlubuhu wa-atamannāh bi-shafāʻat Sayyidat al-ʻĀlamīn wa-bi-ṣalāt al-ṭūbāwī Mārī Afrām wa-Mārī Mārūn wa-Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn wa-jamīʻ al-qiddīsīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note: Translation of the colophon: "The biography of the great blessed and divine teacher Saint Ephrem the Syrian is completed by its translator from Syriac into Arabic Buṭrus Rizq al-ʻAndārī, a student of the School of Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn at the mentioned monastery. He requests from any intelligent and learned reader to disregard any mistake in spelling or sentence structure. Glory be to the Only Infallible One. This booklet was concluded on 17 January 1895. May God grant us to live according to the example of this great saint and emulate his holy life. This is what I am asking and hope for through the intercession of Our Lady and the prayers of the blessed Saint Ephrem, Saint Mārūn, Saint Yūḥannā Mārūn and all the saints. Amen."

title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.

Naḥmaduka Allāhumma yā man tafarrada bi-al-ījād wa-al-taʼthīr wa-taqaddasa ʻan al-sharikah wa-al-ʻanād fī ʻumūm al-ikhtiyār wa-al-taqdīr wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallimu ʻalá man jabara ʻulamāʼ ummatihi bi-amdādihi fa-iktasabū min asrār ḥikmatihi wa-qāmū bi-amr Allāh bayna ʻibādih ..."

note: Secundo folio: jazā Allāh ʻannā kull ḥabr.

note: 17 x 24 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.

note: Binding: Unbound.

title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.
note: In fair naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper with some markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.
note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn taʼlīf al-shams al-munīr Shaykhunā al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-mashhūr bi-al-Amīr nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak min shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1215. Wa-al-ḥamd lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Bukhārī ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-uṣūl uṣūlih wa-furūʻ furūʻih."

title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "The writing of this treatise was concluded on blessed Monday in blessed Ramaḍān, 1215. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the most high and the most powerful. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the illiterate prophet and on his family and companions and grant them peace. [Copied by] Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Bukhārī. May God forgive him and the origins of his origins and the branches of his branches."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note: Title from folio 2a.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note: Incipit: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-manẓūmatī al-kubrá allatī fī manāzil al-qamar. Wa-hādhā awān al-shurūʻ fī al-maqṣūd fa-aqūlu mustaʻīnan billāh ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note: In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper with the phrases of the original in red; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note: On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-Qamar ʻafá Allāh ʻan muʼallifihā Imāminā al-muḥaqqiq al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihi. Āmīn. ʻĪsá Muḥammad al-Bukhārī. Sanat 1220 Hijrīyah."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Intahá mā wajadtuhu bi-khaṭṭ Shaykhinā waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi al-ʻallāmah al-fāḍil wa-al-ʻumdah al-kāmil fasaḥ Allāh fī muddatihi wa-abqāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamma naskh hādhihi al-risālah min nuskhat muʼallifihā al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī ʻalá yad rājī ʻafwa al-Bārī ʻĪsá Muḥammad Aḥmad ḥafīd al-Ustādh ʻAlī al-madʻū bi-al-Bukhārī nafaʻanā Allāh bihim. Āmīn. Tammat."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "God knows the truth better. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master and Lord Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. Concluded is what I found in handwriting of our teacher the unique of his time and the distinguished of his era the virtuous scholar and the perfect authority, may God prolong his life, protect him and benefit us and the Muslims by him. Amen. The copying of this treatise was done from the copy of its author Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī by the hand of him who hopes for the forgiveness of the Creator ʻĪsá Muḥammad Aḥmad the grandson of the teacher ʻAlī called al-Bukhārī, may God benefit us by them. Amen. It is concluded."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note: At head of folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Rāʼīyah."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note: Colophon of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "Najazat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād al-ḍuʻafāʼ Muṣṭafá najl al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ḥāwī al-faḍāʼil al-Shaykh ʻAlī Fayyāḍ al-Balqaṭrī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-lil-qāriʼ wa-al-mustamiʻ wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-muqaddimah al-Rāʼīyah fī rasm al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm taʼlīf Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Shāṭibī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min nafaḥātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah fī 26 Rabīʻī [Rabīʻ] al-Thānī min shuhūr sanat 1071, ghafara Allāh li-nāẓimihā wa-lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note: Translation of the colophon of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "The treatise was concluded by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest and weakest of the servants al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ḥāwī al-faḍāʼil al-Shaykh ʻAlī Fayyāḍ al-Balqaṭrī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him and his parents and them who invoke God on his behalf to forgive him. May God forgive also the readers and listeners and all Muslims. Concluded is the copying of "al-Muqaddimah al-Rāʼīyah" on the orthography of the glorious Qurʼan, by Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Shāṭibī, May God benefit us by his blessings and encompass us by his grace in this world and in the hereafter, on 26 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1071. May God forgive its author and all believers, men and women, and all Muslims, men and women, the living among them and the dead. Amen. Amen. Amen."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note: Colophon of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Kātib al-khaṭṭ Muṣṭafá ibn Qāsim, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ ..."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note: Translation of the colophon of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "The copying of the treatise was concluded by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence, by Muṣṭafá ibn Qāsim, May God forgive him and his parents and all ..."

note: On folio 1a: "Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Jalāl al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakatih. Āmīn." "Wa-yalīhi Inbāh al-adhkiyāʼ bi-ḥayāt al-anbiyāʼ la-hu ayḍan. Wa-yalīhi Bushrá al-labīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb la-hu ayḍan." (These two titles are not in the present manuscript).

title: 880-02 Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
note: Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-kitāb wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam muddata dhikr al-dhākirīn wa-sahw al-ghāfilīn ṣalātan dāʼimah mustamirah ilá yawm al-dīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-02 Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the book. Praise be to God in all matters. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the seal of the prophets and the leader of the messengers, and on his family and companions and grant them peace as long as He is remembered by those who remember and by those who are negligent, a continuous and permanent prayer until judgement day. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

Tamm."

Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib Abū al-Muntahá ʻaṣamahu Allāh taʻālá al-kabīr al-karīm ʻan al-khaṭāyā wa-al-maʻāṣī wa-min al-iʻtiqād al-fāsid al-ʻaqīm inna kitāb al-Fiqh al-akbar alladhī ṣannafahu al-Imām al-aʻẓam kitāb ṣaḥīḥ ... fa-ardtu an ajmaʻa kalimāt min al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-min al-kutub al-muʻtabarah ḥattá takūna sharḥan li-hādhā al-kitāb al-sharīf al-laṭīf ..."

note: On folio 1b: "Kitāb Abū al-Muntahá raḥmat Allāh ʻlayh."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar : manuscript / Abū al-Muntahá Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Maghnīsāwī.
note: Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-malik al-wahhāb fī baldat Arzanjān fī Madrasat Muʼmin yad [bi-yad] ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān fī shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir fī yawm al-Sabt sanat tisʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-alf."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar : manuscript / Abū al-Muntahá Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Maghnīsāwī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "The book is concluded by the help of God, the benevolant king, in the city of Arzanjān, at the School of Muʼmin, by Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, the feeble and sinful servant who is in need of the mercy of God the most high, on Saturday, in the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1099."

title: [Psalter and prayers].
note: Bound in plain wooden boards; four chain stitches, in leather case consisting of two parts, with carrying strap. Ff. 3r-130r: Psalter and Praises of Mary. Contains depictions of David and Gabriel(?). Some small holes in ms. Some marginal prayers. Some purple ink and pencil marginalia. Ethiopic writing and grafitti in the flyleaves. Includes printed page of Pss 3 and 4. Includes 1930 letters (copies) from Richard Gottheil of Columbia University regarding the ms.

title: [Psalter and prayers].
note: Ff. 1r-1v (written upside down): Concluding prayer to be recited after the Praises of Mary, including appeals to Mary to intercede for members of the family of the owner of the book, Qaṣalā Giyoregis, in an untrained hand. Otherwise in the hand of Takela Giyoregis in red and black with the exception of ownership notes and pen trials. In Geʼez.

title: [Psalter and prayers].
note: F. 130v: Colophon begins with a condemnation on anyone who steals or erases anything in the book. The book was written by Takela Giyoregis in 1917 EC, Tahsas 1.

title: [Psalter and prayers].
note: F. 132v: Pen trials, based on the opening prayer of the Psalter.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Title from reference sources, the printed version and folio 1a.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh ʻalá tawālī niʻamih wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlih Muḥammad wa-ʻitratih al-maʻṣūmīn fa-qad ʻazamtu ʻalá an ashraḥa Muqaddimat Ibn al-Ḥājib fī al-taṣrīf wa-al-khaṭṭ wa-absiṭa al-kalām fī sharḥihā ka-mā fī sharḥ ukhtihā baʻḍ al-basṭ fa-inna al-shurrāḥ qad iqtaṣarū ʻalá sharḥ muqaddimat al-iʻrāb wa-hādhā maʻa qurb al-taṣrīf min al-iʻrāb fī masās al-ḥājah wa-maʻa kawnihimā min jins wāḥid baʻīd min al-ṣawāb ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Secundo folio: faʻīl wa-fuʻayʻil wa-fuʻayʻīl.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: 16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Binding: In buckram binding with red leather on spine and flap (in 22 numbered quires).

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with the phrases of the "Shāfiyah" in purple; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: On folio 1a: "Shāfiyah fī al-taṣrīf li-Abī ʻAmr ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn al-Ḥājib al-Naḥwī al-Mālikī al-mutawaffá sanat 646 sitt wa-arbaʻīn wa-sittimiʼah wa-hiya muqaddimah mashhūrah fī hādhā al-fann ka-muqaddimat al-Kāfiyah fī al-naḥw wa-la-hu ʻalayhā sharḥ. Wa-qad iʻtaná bi-shaʼnihā jamāʻah min al-shurrāḥ ajalluhum al-Shaykh Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādī. Wa-mā atá bi-hi sharḥ jāmiʻ awwaluhu 'Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh taʻālá ʻalá tawālī niʻamih' ilá ākhirihi, kadhā fī Kashf al-Ẓunūn bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: On folio 1a an endowment statement: "Waqafa wa-aḥbasa hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad al-Bahī ibn al-Shaykh Muṣṭafá al-Ḥuwayḥī thumma al-Ṭandatānī ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-jaʻala al-naẓar li-nafsihi thumma li-man yaṣluḥu min awlādihi waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan lā yubāʻu wa-lā yurhanu wa-lā yubaddalu, fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Taḥrīran fī 3 Rajab sanat 1294 [14 July, 1877]."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh mulhim al-ṣawāb wa-al-sadād al-muwaffiq li-man arāda al-wuṣūl ilá al-murād wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-Nabī al-ʻAdnān wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-fāyizīn min Allāh bi-al-jinān. Wa-baʻd fa-yaqūlu al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻālim Muḥammad ʻAlī al-mulaqqab bi-Abī Sālim: Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh ṣāḥib al-niʻam al-kāfiyah naskhī sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Raḍī al-Dīn ʻalá al-Shāfiyah fa-jāʼa bi-ḥamd Allāh muḥarraran muwaḍḍaḥan wa-munaqqaḥan muhadhdhaban muṣaḥḥaḥan wa-kāna dhālika al-tamām wa-al-ḥuṣūl wa-al-khitām muwāfiqan li-thamāniyah wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalat min shahr Jumād al-Awwal alladhī huwa min shuhūr iḥdá wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man khalaqahu Allāh ʻalá akmal waṣf ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-kull nāsij ʻalá minwālih mā tawālá al-jadīdān wa-ṭalaʻa al-Zibriqān. Āmīn, bi-jāh al-Amīn. M."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God who inspires what is true and correct and grants success to whoever endeavors to reach his goal. May prayer and peace be upon the ʻAdnanite Prophet, his family and his companions to whom God granted Paradise. Thereafter, Muḥammad ʻAlī, nicknamed Abū Sālim, who hopes for the forgiveness from his All Knowing Lord, says: Concluded is -- by the praise of God the bestower of the abundant graces -- the copying of the commentary of the learned scholar Raḍī al-Dīn on al-Shāfiyah. It was edited, explained, revised, elucidated and corrected. This was accomplished on the 28th of Jumād al-Awwal, of the year 1291 of the Hijrah of the One whom God created with perfect character, may God pray upon him and upon his family and those who follow him, as long as night and day alternate and the Moon shines, by the intercession of the the Faithful One. Amen."

title: 880-01 Image of Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Jesus Christ = Malekeʼe Māryām [ʼenā] malekʼa ʼIyasus.
note: In fair hand, in red and black.

title: 880-01 Image of Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Jesus Christ = Malekeʼe Māryām [ʼenā] malekʼa ʼIyasus.
note: On f. 11v, the scribe is mentioned, Gabera ʼAb.

title: 880-01 Image of Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Jesus Christ = Malekeʼe Māryām [ʼenā] malekʼa ʼIyasus.
note: Drawings of birds (ff. 1rv) and harags (f. 22r), in pencil. Contains decorative images of crosses...A large hole in f. 6 is stitched together.

Dalla bi-lāmay al-jins wa-al-mulk ʻalá ikhtiṣāṣ al-ḥamd bi-hi taʻālá, thumma waṣafahu bi-inzāl al-Qurʼān wa-tanzīlih wa-mā ardafahumā bi-hi riʻāyatan li-barāʻat al-istihlāl ..."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Jurjānī ʻalá Kashshāf al-Zamakhsharī : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Jurjānī ʻalá Kashshāf al-Zamakhsharī : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
note: Colophon: "Intahá mā wujida min Ḥāshiyat al-Sharīf raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá ʻalá al-Kashshāf wa-lillāh al-mashīʼah wa-al-minnah wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad shams falak al-Sunnah wa-ʻalá ālihi nujūm al-dujunnah."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Jurjānī ʻalá Kashshāf al-Zamakhsharī : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "Concluded is what was found of the gloss of al-Sharīf, may God have mercy upon him, on al-Kashshāf. To God belongs the will and gratitude. Prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the sun of the orbit of the Sunnah, and upon his family the [shining] stars in the darkness."

title: 880-02 al-Nafḥah al-miskīyah wa-al-tuḥfah al-Makkīyah : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
note: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Nafḥah al-miskīyah wa-al-tuḥfah al-Makkīyah taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn faṣīḥ ʻaṣrih wa-farīd dahrih al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-barakātih wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-al-Muslimīn min ṣāliḥ daʻawātih fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā."

note: Colophon: "... wa-dhālika fī shahr Allāh Rajab, fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-thānī wa-al-ʻishrīn minhu sanat tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-kafá wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alldhīna iṣṭafá wa-ṣallá Allāh [ʻalá] Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-muṣṭafá."

title: 880-02 al-Nafḥah al-miskīyah wa-al-tuḥfah al-Makkīyah : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded by the praise of God and his abundant benevolence, on Wednesday, 22 of God's month Rajab, 869 [29 March, 1465]. Praise be to God alone and that is sufficient. Peace be on His servants whom He had chosen. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the chosen prophet."

title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.

note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-Jannah manzilan li-ʻibādih al-muʼminīn wa-khaṣṣahum fīhā bi-mazīd al-iḥsān wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādata man qālahā khāliṣan mukhliṣan min qalbihi dakhala al-Jannah wa-muttiʻa fīhā bi-al-ḥūr wa-al-wildān wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammad ʻabudhu wa-rasūluhu awwal man yadkhul al-Jannah wa-yaftaḥu la-hu Riḍwān ..."

title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.

Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.
note: Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah khamsah fī shahr Jumād al-Awwal sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thamāniyah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijr [al-Hijrah] al-Nabwah [al-Nabawīyah] ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Asyūṭī al-Mālikī ghafara Allāh la-hu waliday [wa-li-wālidayhi] wa-mashāyikhihi wa-al-Muslimīn wa-asʼalu Allāh an yanfaʻa bi-hā kamā nafaʻa bi-uṣūlihā wa-an yajʻalahā khāliṣatan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-sababan lil-fawz bi-ruʼyatihi fī janāt al-naʻīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This treatise ended on blessed Friday, 5 Jumād al-Awwal, 1278 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [8 November, 1861] by its poor copyist, Muḥammad al-Asyūṭī al-Mālikī. May God forgive him and his parents, his teachers and all Muslims. I beseech God to make it beneficial as He made beneficial its origins; that God may be please with me and a reason to enable me to see Him in the Paradise of Bliss. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and all his companions. Amen."

title: In memoriam: Julius M. Keeler : manuscript.
note: Title from cover.

title: [Psalter, image of Michael, Asmat prayer against a snake, and prayer of faith.].

note: Ff. 1r-129v written in one column, ff. 130r-145r written in two columns. 22 lines. Some tears and holes in ms repaired by stitching. Some holes are written around, demonstrating that the parchment had gaps before use for writing. Sparse marginalia. Some wax stains.

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: Incipit of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻaẓīm wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá wa-ālih [ālihi] wa-sallam. Saʼalta ayyuhā al-murīd al-mustarshid ʻan kunh mā lā budda laka minhu fa-ajabtuka fī hādhihi al-awrāq ʻalá mā saʼalta wa-Allāh walī al-tawfīq ..."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: Secundo folio of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: al-ān ʻalá mā ʻalayhi kān.

note: Incipit of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nazzala ahla al-Ḥadīth aʻlā [aʻlá] manāzil al-tashrīf wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī shahidat al-āyāt al-Qurʼānīyah wa-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah bi-annahu al-sayyid al-ʻafīf ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-rājī rabbahu al-raʼūf al-laṭīf Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Raʼūf: Hādhā kitāb awradtu fīhi bi-mā lam usbaq min al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah al-wāridah ʻan khayr al-barīyah ... wa-sammaytuhu al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah ..."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: On the lower left margin of folio 48a: "Iʻlam anna fī baʻḍ tilka al-Aḥādīth tawaqqufan min aṣl al-nuskhah al-manqūl minhā wa-kadhā aṣluhā wa-aṣluhā fa-ifham wa-ḥarrir wa-Allāh yatawallá hudāk. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: Colophon of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: "Intahá wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-ḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: Translation of the colophon Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: "It is concluded. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. It is finished."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: Colophon of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī waqt al-ʻaṣr min yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak al-muwāfiq li-iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalat min shahr Jumād al-Awwal sanat 1286, sittah wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥabihi wa-sallam."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note: Translation of the colophon of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: "The copying of this noble copy ended in the afternoon of blessed Sunday, 21 Jumād al-Awwal , 1286 [29 August, 1869] of the Hijrah of the glorious and honorable [Prophet]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

note: Title from folio 1b.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūl afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajuhum ilá Allāh al-ʻalī al-qadr wa-al-shaʼn al-rājī minhu tabāraka wa-taʻālá al-raḥmah wa-al-ghufrān ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī. Hādhihi risālah fī uṣūl al-dīn jamaʻtuhā li-ṣighār al-banāt wa-al-banīn wa-sammaytuhā al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān, jaʻalahā Allāh khāliṣah li-wajhihi al-karīm ..."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: Secundo folio: wa-anna Sayyidanā Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: 12.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 7 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: Binding: Unbound.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān li-ʻIzz al-Dīn Bik ʻAlī Maʼmūr Mālīyat Dunqulah ḥafiẓahu [Allāh] wa-aʻānahu wa-fataḥa ʻalayh. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Tamm."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: On folio 9b: 1. A poem in praise of the treatise by "Ḥaḍrat al-ʻĀlim al-shahīr Mawlānā al-Shaykh ʻAlī Ḥusayn al-Bulāqī [probably, al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn al-Masraʻī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Būlāqī who was alive 1307/1890]." 2. A poem by al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Majīd al-Ghubāshī al-Azʹharī (could not be identified) praising the treatise and dating it in alphabetical reckoning (ḥsāb al-jummal): Halimmū ilayhā wa-iqraʼūhā wa-arrikhū // Zahat bi-bahāʼ al-ṭabʻi tilka al-Farāʼidu. 324."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: On folio 10a: A short invocation in a different hand.

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: Colophon: "Katab hādhihi al-risālah al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Qūṣī Yūsuf Ḥasan Nawfal al-Ḥajjājī. Wa-kāna tamāmuhā yawm al-Khamīs ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn al-Ḥijjah sanat alf wa-thalāthmiʼah wa-thalāthat ʻashar. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This treatise was copied by the poor and despised, who hopes for the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Qūṣī Yūsuf Ḥasan Nawfal al-Ḥajjājī, on Thursday 22 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1313 [4 June, 1896]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

note: Title from folio 2b.

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahidat li-waḥdānīyatihi al-āyāt al-bayyinah fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāwāt, wa-qāmat ʻalá rubūbīyatihi al-dalālāt, wa-dallat ʻalá ʻaẓamatihi ʻināyatuhu bi-al-aḥyāʼ wa-al-amwāt ... wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu ... Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī mawlidan al-Anṣārī nasaban ... fa-sharaʻtu fī dhālika mustaʻīnan bi-al-Malik al-qadīr yawm al-Sabt, rābiʻ Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1231, wa-sammaytuhu Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-muhadhdhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab ..."

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: Secundo folio: yawm al-Thulāthāʼ salkh Rajab.
