note: 16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 19 cm; 27 lines per page.

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: Binding: In red leather binding with geometrical designs and flap (in 67 quires, quire 1 to 54 are numbered).

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: In good naskh script, in black ink, on white aging paper, headings, keywords and markings in red; some corrections and notes on the margins; catchwords.

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: On folio 1a an endowment statement in the name of Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Sinjārī.

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: On folio 1a (in pencil): "Sharḥ al-Sindī ʻalá Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī."

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna farāghī min taswīd hādhā al-mujallad al-awwal min Sharḥ Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fī yawm al-Sabt sābiʻ wa-ʻishrīn min Dhī al-Qaʻdah sanat 1234 bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah qubayla al-ʻaṣr. Jaʻalahu Allāh min al-aʻmāl al-maqbūlah wa-waffaqanī li-itmām sharḥihi fī aqrab al-awqāt. Kutiba bi-qalam muʼallifihi Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Anṣārī al-Sindī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-aslāfihi wa-mashāyikhihi wa-muḥibbīhi wa-jamīʻ aqāribih bi-faḍlihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Wa-ghafara li-kātibihi wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man ṭālaʻahu wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note: Translation of the author's colophon: "The writing of the first volume of Sharḥ Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, May God have mercy upon him, was finished on Saturday, 27 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1234 in Mecca, before the afternoon, May God render it an acceptable work and may He grant me the ability to complete the commentary as soon as possible. Written by its author Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Anṣārī al-Sindī, May God, the Most High, forgive him, his ancestors, his teachers, his beloved ones and all Muslims, by his grace and generosity. Amen. May God also forgive its copyist, his parents, those who read it and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and grant them abundant peace."

title: 880-03 al-Adhkār al-Nawawīyah, aw, Ḥilyat al-abrār wa-shiʻār al-akhyār fī talkhīṣ al-daʻawāt wa-al-adhkār al-mustaḥabbah fī al-layl wa-al-nahār : manuscript / Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
note: Title from the printed versions (title page damaged).

note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Yā man aḥzābuhu lam tazal muʼayyadah, ʻalá al-aʻdāʼ manṣūrah, wa-aḥbābuhu lam tazal aʻlāmuhum bi-dhikrihi manshūrahk, fī ṣūrah aʻẓim bi-hā min ṣūrah. Naḥmaduka ʻalá ālāʼika al-ʻāmmah madadta bi-hā fa-lam takun maqṣūrah ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Ḥizb al-Nawawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī.
note: Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu ʻabd Allāh taʻālá al-faqīr ilá ʻafwihi wa-maghfiratih Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī thumma al-Madanī kāna Allāh la-hu wa-jaʻalahu mimman lil-wilāyah ahlah: Wāfaqa al-farāgh minhu ḍaḥwat al-Ithnayn al-tāsiʻ min Ṣafar al-Khayr ʻām ithnayn wa-khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf bi-manzilī bi-al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah taḥta al-Manārah al-Sulaymānīyah min al-Masjid al-Sharīf ṣallá Allāh ʻalá musharrifihi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Ḥizb al-Nawawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "Its author, the servant of God who is in need of His pardon and forgiveness, Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī al-Madanī, May God be on his side and make him worthy of the Sufi status (wilāyah) said: The book was finished on Monday morning, the ninth of Ṣafar, the year 1152 at my home in al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah under the Sulaymānīyah Minaret of al-Masjid al-Sharīf, May God pray on Him who had honored it by His presence, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God alone."

title: [Miracles of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Galawedéwos (Claudius)].
note: Bound in plain wooden boards; four chain stitches, in leather slip-case, with loops for missing carrying strap. Some holes and tears in parchment stitched back together. Sparse marginalia.

title: [Miracles of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Galawedéwos (Claudius)].
note: Notes: F. i r(ecto): “Miracles of the Virgin” written in a Western hand; F. 12r and passim mention the owner, ገብራ ገላወዴዎስ; Blank: ff. i v(erso)–ii v(erso), the two folios (recto and verso) between numbered folios 52 and 53, 91r–92v.

title: [Miracles of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Galawedéwos (Claudius)].
note: Two columns (ff. 1r–86v); One column (ff. 87r–90v). 14 lines.

title: [Psalter, Song of Songs, and hymn].
note: Wood covers, four chain stitches, leather Oriental binding, fine cloth visible between the paste downs. German typescript of Holmes' notes glued to the flyleaf -- Holmes mentions that the MS contains a Psalter, Song of Songs, and a praise of Mary, and hypothesizes regarding the purpose of the outer calf-skin capsule. Sparse marginalia and scribal corrections. Some holes and tears in MS are stitched back together. Minor worming on the back cover.

title: [Psalter, Song of Songs, and hymn].
note: One column (ff. 1r–123v; two columns (ff. 129r–145v). 24 lines.

title: [Psalter, Song of Songs, and hymn].
note: F. 1r. Face plate pasted over the text: Yale University Library. Gideon Scull and Elizabeth Holmes Memorial. Gift of Edmund Wales Holmes, AB, MD. Class of 1872. 1920 [date of donation?]; F. 2 contains a report in German of the contents and date of the book, in which the writer makes a case for the 17th century. However, the Psalter is clearly written by a hand of the late-nineteenth or early-twentieth century; Blank: Ff. 2v–4v, 145r–148v; Word for God is rubricated throughout.

title: [Psalter, with Psalms of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, with Biblical Canticles, Song of Songs, and Gate of Light].
note: Oriental leather binding over wooden boards; one column (ff. 1r–189v); two columns (ff. 190r–209r). 20 lines per page.

title: [Psalter, with Psalms of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, with Biblical Canticles, Song of Songs, and Gate of Light].
note: Contains an English translation of Psalm 151 in the flyleaf. Some tears and holes in MS stitched together. Some later scribal alterations.

title: [Psalter, with Psalms of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, with Biblical Canticles, Song of Songs, and Gate of Light].
note: F. ii v, note of provenance: "This Psalter was one of the books found in Magdala when that place was taken by Sir Robert Napier, afterwards Lord Napier of Magdala, in 1868. The collection had been formed by [King] Theodore with the intention of founding a large Library. These books were carried off by our people, and partly given to Abyssinian churches on the march back to Zayla [?], and a number were brought back to England for our own and for foreign libraries. When nearing Zoula on the return march, M. Munzinger, who had charge of the books, found that he had a few to spare, and among them was this Psalter, which he gave to me. -- William Simpson, 2nd April, 1881."; F. 1r: note in the upper margin: ዳዊት ዘ ቅዱስ መድኃኔ ዓለም (this is the statement that the Psalter belonged to the Great Library to be formed at Magdala by Theodore -- W. Simpson); Fine cloth is visible between the paste downs of the front and back cover; The Qalu counting employs the number 9, and does not include the strophes of the Virgin Mary; Blank: ff. iii r, 209v.

title: Miniature of Benedictine nun kneeling before Christ.
note: Script: banderole text in a small Gothic bookhand.

title: Miniature of Benedictine nun kneeling before Christ.
note: Decoration: an example of the simple illustration style known as "nonnenarbeiten," which are devotional images produced by medieval nuns for personal use. The nun and Christ are placed in a grassy field comprised of penstrokes covered with a green wash. Details like Christ's wounds are conveyed through penstrokes as well. The instruments of the Passion are individually colored with wash: red and black for the cock, orange for the sponge, and orange for parts of the spear. An alternating blue and orange wash has been used to decorate the border of the miniature.

title: Miniature of Benedictine nun kneeling before Christ.

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: Incipit: "Ujriyat bi-mā fīhi. Bi-al-Bāb al-ʻĀlī, aʻlāhu Allāh, subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá, wa-sharrafahu, bi-Miṣr al-maḥrūsah, baʻda al-idhn al-karīm min Ḥaḍrat Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā, fakhr al-mawālī al-ʻiẓām, qāḍī quḍāt al-Islām yawmaidhin bi-Miṣr al-maḥmīyah, al-muwaqqaʻ khaṭṭuhu wa-khatmuhu al-karīmayn aʻlāh, dāma ʻulāh. Āmīn, lil-faqīr ʻAlī al-Khaṭīb, aḥad kuttāb hādhihi al-Maḥkamah, bi-samāʻ wa-kitābat mā yaʼtī dhikruhu fīhi fa-ladayhi bi-al-majlis al-munʻaqid bi-Dīwān Qūmisiyūn al-Arāḍī al-Mīrīyah, al-kāʼin bi-Shāriʻ Jāmiʻ al-Kanjīyah, bi-Qism ʻĀbidīn, bi-Miṣr: Asqaṭa Wakīl Ḥaḍrat Mawlānā al-Khudaywi al-muʻaẓẓam, Muḥammad Tawfīq Bāshā, Khudaywi Miṣr ḥālan, dāmat saʻādatuhu wa-tawālat masarratuhu. Āmīn, huwa Janāb Idwār Būtarūn, aʻḍāʼ Faransāwī bi-al-Qūmisiyūn al-madhkūr ḥālan, al-wakālah al-sharʻīyah fī shaʼn mā sa-yudhkaru fīhi wa-ghayrihi, al-maqbūlah bi-al-ṭarīq al-sharʻī, ḥaqq jihat al-mīrī al-mashmūlah bi-wilāyat Ḥaḍrat Mawlānā al-Khudaywi al-muʻaẓẓam al-mushār ilayhi, al-wilāyah al-ʻāmmah lil-ḥurmah Ḥasanah al-maʻrūfah bi-wālidat al-marḥūm Ḥabshī Muḥammad min ʻasākir al-Bāsh Buzk Kān, al-sākinah bi-Nāḥiyat Abū Rajwān al-Qiblī, bi-Mudīrīyat al-Jīzah, bint Sayyid ʻAbduh ibn Sulaymān, min arbāb al-maʻāshāt ..."

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: 27 x 77 cm; written surface: 20 x 65 cm.

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: In naskh/ruqʻah script in black ink, on white paper.

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: At the top of the document: Two embossed illegible seals and one illegible seal in blue.

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: At the head of the document, under the seals: "Ḥujjah sharʻīyah min fawq thamāniyat ʻashar alf ghirsh ilá tisʻat ʻashar alf ghirsh, thamanuhā thamāniyah wa-thamānūn ghirsh. 38."

title: 880-01 Ḥujjah sharʻīyah : manuscript.
note: Colophon. The document ends with: "... thumma ʻuriḍa dhālik ʻalá Ḥaḍrat Mawlānā Afandī, al-mushār ilayhi, fa-lammā an aḥāṭa ʻilmuhu al-karīm bi-dhālik, amara bi-kitābatihi wa-qaydihi bi-al-sijill al-maḥfūẓ ḍabṭan lil-wāqiʻ. Wa-taḥarrara dhālik bi-dūn rasm, bināʼan ʻalá al-khiṭābayn al-wāridayn li-hādhihi al-Maḥkamah min Naẓārat al-Ḥaqqānīyah, al-muʼarrakh aḥaduhumā fī rābiʻ ʻashar Rabīʻ Ākhir, sanat arbaʻ wa-thalāthmiʼah wa-alf [10 January 1887], al-muqayyid bi-nimrah arbaʻah ʻumūm, wa-al-thānī muʼarrakh fī tāsiʻ shahr Shaʻbān, sanat tārīkhihi [3 May, 1887], muqayyid bi-nimrah ithnayn wa-miʼah taḥrīran, fī tārīkhayn, awwaluhumā yawm ṣudūr al-isqāṭ al-madhkūr wa-al-ishhād bi-hi wa-al-tawāfuq ʻalá al-shurūṭ al-marqūmah, wa-huwa sādis shahr al-Qaʻdah, wa-thānīhumā yawm ṣudūr al-iqrār bi-al-qismah al-madhkūrah wa-al-ishhād bi-hi, wa-huwa ʻāshir shahr al-Qaʻdah al-madhkūr, sanat arbaʻ [corrected to sitt] wa-thalāthmiʼah wa-alf. ʻAlī al-Khaṭīb. Quyyidat bi-Sijill al-Mubāyaʻāt, nimrah 34, juzʼ 18, ʻadad 29. [two signatures]."

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.

"al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi al-Muṣṭafá Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn ajmaʻīn. Kitāb al-Ṭahārāt. al-Ṭahārah fī al-lughah ʻibārah ʻan al-naẓāfah, wa-fī al-Sharīʻah, ʻibārah ʻan ghasl aʻḍāʼ makhṣūṣah bi-ṣifah makhṣūṣah, wa-hiya anwāʻ: Ṭahārat al-ṣughrá wa-Ṭahārat al-kubrá, wa-hiya ṭahārah ʻan al-ḥadath, wa-ṭahārat al-thawb wa-al-badan, wa-hiya ṭahārah ʻan al-khabath. Bāb mā yajūzu bi-hi al-wuḍūʼ, wa-mā lā yajūz. Faṣl fī al-miyāh ..."

note: Text ends abruptly on folio 276b, as follows: "... rawá al-Ḍaḥḥāk ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, rḍ, annahu qāl: Yakūnu baʻd al-Nabī nūr yukanná Abū Ḥ, yaḥya dīn Allāh wa-Sunnat Rasūl Allāh ʻalá yadih. Wa-ʻan Anas, qāl, qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Yakūnu fī ākhir al-zamān rajul yukanná bi-Abī Ḥanīfah, yaḥyá dīn Allāh taʻālá wa-Sunnatī ʻalá yadih. Thumma shurrifa bi-al-dhikr fī Ḥadīth ākhar: Muliʼa qalbuhu ʻilman wa-ḥikmah ..."

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.
note: Colophon (at the lower right margin of folio 276b): "Tammat al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad ʻAbd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf, al-muḥtāj, al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Ghanī, Muḥammad ibn Mawlānā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mawlānā Qāsim, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Tārīkhuhu sanat thalāthīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.
note: Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeble, needy and poor to Gracious God, Muḥammad ibn Mawlānā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mawlānā Qāsim, may God forgive him and his parents and treat them and him favorably. Dated in the year 930 [of the Hijrah = 1523/1524]."

title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ammā baʻd ḥamd Allāh ʻadada naʻmāʼihi, wa-al-shukru la-hu ʻalá tawālī ālāʼihi, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Muḥammad khayr anbiyāʼihi, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi khayr awliyāʼihi, fa-inna kitābī al-mawḍūʻ fī ṣināʻat al-hawāʼī, al-musammá bi-al-Maʻūnah, lammā kathura ʻilmuhu, wa-kabura ʻalá himam ʻāmmat ahl al-ʻaṣr ḥajmuhu, raʼaytu an aqtaṣirahu fī awrāq qalīlah ʻalá maqāṣidihi al-jalīlah, li-yakūna la-hu dhālika ka-al-wasīlah, wa-yuqarriba ijtināʼ thamaratihi bi-alṭaf ḥīlah, fa-sharaʻtu fīmā qaṣadtu muʻtamidan ʻalá Allāh al-Karīm fī tasʹhīl mā aradtu, wa-rattabtuhu ayḍan ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāthat aqsām wa-khātimah ..."

title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim.
note: On folio 1a: "Hādhā kitāb matn Wasīlat Ibn al-Hāʼim, nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-barakatihi. Āmīn. Wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn. M M M."

title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim.
note: Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr alladhī awradtuhu kifāyah li-man ʻarafahu. Wa-man arāda al-tabaḥḥur fī hādhā al-fann, wa-al-wuqūf ʻalá mā yashfī al-ghalīl, fa-ʻalayhi bi-al-Maʻūnah. Wa-faragha min taswīdihā muʼallifuhā fī al-thāmin wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 793. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat ʻalá yad Khalīl ibn Aḥmad al-Shabrāwī al-Madābighī, sanat 1198. M M M."

title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim.
note: Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. What I introduced here is enough for him who masters it. However, if someone wants to delve into this art and aquire what satiates his thirst, he should study 'al-Maʻūnah'. The author finished writing the draft on 28 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 793 of the Hijrah [12 April, 1391]. God is more knowledgeable. Copied by Khalīl ibn Aḥmad al-Shabrāwī al-Madābighī, in the year 1198 [of the Hijrah = 1783/1784]. M M M."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Title from reference sources.

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Romanization supplied by cataloger.

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-ghanī bi-luṭfihi, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Khaldūn al-Ḥaḍramī, waffaqahu Allāh taʻālá: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī la-hu al-ʻizzah wa-al-jabarūt, wa-bi-yadihi al-mulk wa-al-malakūt, wa-la-hu al-asmāʼ al-ḥusná wa-al-nuʻūt, al-ʻālim fa-lā [yaghrubu ʻanhu mā] yuẓhiruhu [tuẓhiruhu] al-najwá, aw yukhfīhi al-sukūt, al-qādir, fa-lā yuʻjizuhu shayʼ fī al-samāwāt wa-al-arḍ wa-lā yafūt, anshaʼanā min al-arḍ nasaman, wa-istaʻmaranā fīhā ajyālan wa-umaman, wa-yassara lanā minhā arzāqan wa-qisaman, yukannifunā al-arḥām wa-al-buyūt, wa-yakfulunā al-rizq wa-al-qūt, wa-tablīnnā al-ayyām wa-al-wuqūt, wa-taʻtawirunā al-ājāl allatī khaṭṭa ʻalaynā kitābahā al-mawqūt, wa-la-hu al-baqāʼ wa-al-thubūt, wa-Huwa al-ḥayy alladhī lā yamūt ..."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Secundo folio: min al-qurūn al-uwal.

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: 22.5 x 34.5 cm; written surface: 14 x 24 cm; 31 lines per page.

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Binding: In marbled cardboard with dark red leather on spine.

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; text within double red frame; catchwords.

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: On folio 2b: "... wa-rattabtuhu ʻalá muqaddimah wa-thalāthat kutub. al-Muqaddimah: Fī faḍl ʻilm al-tārīkh, wa-taḥqīq madhāhibihi, wa-al-ilmāʻ bi-maghāliṭ al-muʼarrikhīn ..."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: On folio 3a: "... sammaytuhu 'Kitāb al-ʻibar wa-dīwān al-mubtadaʼ wa-al-khabar fī ayyām al-ʻArab wa-al-ʻAjam wa-al-Barbar wa-man ʻāṣarahum min dhawī al-sulṭān al-akbar' ..."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā katabahu al-Faqīh Ibn Khaldūn. Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih wa-tawfīqhi kitāb Muqaddiamt al-Shaykh al-Faqīh, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, farīd ʻaṣrih wa-waḥīd dahrih, Ibn Khaldūn, raḥimahu Allāh wa-taghammadahu bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātih. Āmīn. Bi-jāh Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākharīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-qadīr, al-muʻtarf bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, ʻAlī Muḥammad al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, sabʻata ʻashar yawman khalat [rubbamā baqiyat] min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 1270 min Hijratihi, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note: Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was written by the Scholar Ibn Khaldūn. Completed, by the praise of God and His help and abundant benevolence, is the book of 'al-Muqaddimah' of the learned scholar, the unique in his time and age, Ibn Khaldūn, may God have mercy upon him, shield him with His compassion and bestow upon the Muslims of his blessings. Amen. By the intercession of the Master of the Former and the Latter, our Master Muḥammad, may the best prayer and peace be upon him. Copied by the hand of the poor to the mercy of his Mighty Lord, he who admits his disability and inefficiency, ʻAlī Muḥammad al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions and grant them peace. The copy of this blessed part was completed on blessed Thursday, seventeen days having passed [probably remaining] of the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1270 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [12 January, 1854], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."

title: Pedigree showing descent of Lord and Lady Pomfret from King Edward I, circa 1750.
note: Note, in 19th century hand, pasted on front flyleaf: From Horace Walpole's letters to Sir Hor. Mann, Sept. 1st, 1750, "I have seen one [a pedigree] infinitely richer and better done, it is for my Lady Pomfret. She and my Lord both descend from King Edward I by his two Queens. The Pedigree is painted in a book; instead of a vulgar genealogical tree, she has devised a pine-apple plant, sprouting out of a basket on which is King Edward's head; on the leaves are all the intermediate arms." v. 2, p. 222. 1857 ed.

title: Letter to Horace Walpole / Mrs. Porter, [1738?].
note: Dated conjecturally by the reference to the 'ingenious paper' which may have been, as Toynbee suggests, the 'essay' on Mrs Porter as Clytemnestra in James Thomson's Agamemnon, referred to in Thomas Gray to Horace Walpole 23 Feb. 1738 (GRAY i. 151 and n. 2). Mrs Porter played Clytemnestra at the first performance of Agamemnon 6 April 1738 at Drury Lane (London Stage Pt III, ii. 710). Walpole had apparently written to Gray on the subject while the play was in rehearsal. Address: To the Honourable Horace Walpole.

title: Letter to Horace Walpole / Mrs. Porter, [1738?].
